There is a wistful look on your friends face "it must be nice" he smiles as he looks back towards you "Well still want to check out the eating contest?"
11122112.title: You have to talk to that haxorus!

choices: Nod your head, "I'll stay with your" (First mystery dungeon!)
Shake your head "I don't want to slow you down"
111221122.content:
As the two of you are about to head on your way a pair of vines tap Andre's shoulder. "I am so glad I found you," a relieved voice sounds out from the direction of the vines revealing a fairly large serperior. "Three of the other workers never showed today and I'm going to need to ask you to come in tomorrow." For it's part the serpent looks a bit regretful.

Andre turns around a little surprised to see the newcomer. "Oh, hey there Emerald. I was just showing a new friend around town" he pauses for a second to pat you on the shoulder. "Meet Kristina!" he says a bit excitedly.

"Hello sir" You find yourself nodding your head before the regal looking serpent. "Nice to meet you."

"So what's this about three mons not showing up?" Andre tilts his whole body to the side as he asks the question.

"It's nice to meet you as well," Emerald extends one of his vines towards you clearly looking for a sort of handshake to which you oblige. "It's just like I said, Jasper, Bennet, and Nix didn't return to the farm this morning. Given there size and everything.." He trails off with a bit of a shrug. "It's only natural to assume that someone gobbled them up."

Andre nods a bit before grinning as he looks at you, it's almost like he can see your blush even through that red fur. "Probably, no use sweating over it if they made the decision though, can't say it hasn't been tempting right Kristina."

For your part you just nod a bit. Why did all these thoughts of Pokemon just eating each other leave you so flushed. "So what now then?"

"Well, I'm likely going to be heading in to cover for my gurgled co-workers, as for you Kristina that's going to be up to you" Andre looks towards Emerald "Do you mind if she tags along tomorrow, she's kind of really new to town?"

The serpent raises a vine towards it's chin. "I don't see why not, long as she can handle herself against the vermin" he takes a moment to size you up "She does know enough to be able to fend off a caterpie yes?"

"oh, uh probably" You blurt out a bit hastily "Andre helped me learn tackle just this morning!"

Emerald nods a bit, clearly not impressed "Well as long as she stays with you then, she's your responsibility if anything pops up"

Andre smiles a bit "It'll be great experience for you, plus emerald here pays a good amount for keeping pest Pokemon off the crops." He takes a moment "That is if you want to come along, otherwise you can always explore the city on your own for a bit" He grins at you.
111221122.title: Another Pokemon interrupts your tour

choices: Over the lips and past the gums.
You really don't want your first poke'meal to be a bug do you?
1112211221.content:
After a bit of traveling around town and one good nights sleep (complete with another gigantic in your opinion meal), you and Andre start making your way to the outskirts of town. The farm itself is a sprawling affair that looks like it goes on for miles upon miles, with a few building scattered through out. When the two of you arrive at the largest building Emerald comes out.

"Good good, I was a little worried considering the inclinations of your new friend." He gives you a knowing smile before pointing towards a cart with one of his vines. "The cart itself is filled with water barrels, just pulling it will distribute water along the field. If you come across any pests eating the plants please take them out, in any way you see fit" his smirk towards Andre gives you a good hint of just what he means there.

"Don't worry I'll handle the cart if you want to keep an eye out for bug types and the like" Says your companion "Should be able to finish up before noon" he pats you on the back before grabbing the cart.

"Sure thing!" you say excitedly before falling in next to Andre, your first time going out into the field, even if it's a farm.

~

After about an hour of walking the two of you encounter a pair of caterpie that are just sitting there munching down on the leaves of some tomato plants. as you point them out Andre's cheeks light up with a crackle of electricity, "hope you're hungry, I know I could use a snack." As he lashes out with a thunderbolt on one of them you use the only move in your arsenal, Tackle. You kind of expected the bug to be a bit stronger but it goes down with only one blow.

"That was anti climatic." You say with a bit of a tilt of your head. "I kinda thought they'd be a bit harder with how worried you were" As you look back at Andre you notice the caterpie he took down is already halfway down his gullet. "You weren't kidding were you"

"..." gulping noises as his eyes say it all

"right, guess no one minds since they're thieves after all" you look down at the other caterpillar Pokemon.
1112211221.title: Nod your head, "I'll stay with your"...

choices: The two of you finish the dungeon without any issues.
You encounter a dangerous Bandit, a Scolipede at the end.
11122112211.content:
Giving the Caterpie a lick you find yourself agreeing with the flavor. You hold the almost limp bug down before trying to open your jaws wide enough to take in the the caterpillar Pokemon. It feels like a struggle just to part your jaws, and they're getting no where near enough to do the feat of gluttony that Andre is accomplishing. All you seem to be doing is coating the smaller Pokemon in drool.

"Relax a bit, just do what comes naturally. Don't try and force it or you'll end up choking." Says the pikachu now with a much larger belly. He pats his belly

"Alright" You nod while closing your eyes. "Just take it slow, take it naturally" With a slight breath in and out you once more lick the Caterpie. It takes a moment but you find your jaws parting just enough to engulf it's tail. Breathing through your nose you slowly start working your way up the KO'd bug. While the flavor is good, the softer flesh of the bug definitely gives a squishier texture than you were expecting.

"Good work, take it slow. Keep swallowing" Andre encourages you as you go. "One and two and one and two."

With his encouragement it's not long before you find yourself gulping down the last of the Caterpie. "phew, that was harder than I thought it'd be."

"Don't worry keep swallowing mon's and eventually you'll even be able to eat pokemon that are bigger than you!" Andre beams at you before turning to continue working. "Well snack times over, time to get back to it!" He practically bounces, while you find yourself dragging your swollen belly along. Still you've got to keep up, and you have to admit it does feel pretty good.
11122112211.title: Over the lips and past the gums.

12.content:
You're just a regular citizen of Juniper Town, and your story begins right as the Exploration Guild lands at the town's dock! Do you trust the guild, or are you suspicious of them? Have you been driven to desperation by this drought, or have you been eating perfectly well? All of these questions are up to you! You have a wide range of Pokemon you can choose from, but remember that you're likely not going to be nearly as strong as guild members, or even outlaws! Thus, trying to get out and explore the world might prove dangerous!

Speaking of which, now we have to decide on your species...
12.title: The Common Folk

121.content: Which one would you like to be?
121.title: Archen / Archeops

122.content: Which one would you want to be?
122.title: Riolu / Lucario

choices: Ray wants to find a surpluss of food to bring home
Ray wants to stop this drought so he can live at his house
Ray goes out into town and tries to make a living for himself
Ray decides he's gonna leave town to make a better living for himself
12211.content:
Being alone in Juniper Town at this time was a precarious way to live. Food and water was scarce, and several Pokémon were desperate to do anything to alleviate their hunger and thirst. This Riolu, Ray, was one of those lonely Pokémon. For a while, he'd lived a happy life with his parents, them able to scrape by with what little scraps they could muster, though lately those scraps were getting smaller and smaller. So, maybe Ray should've seen it coming...

He went to bed, his family not having a meal one day. And when he woke up, he was at the other side of the town, left in some alley. He fought through his hunger and tried to approach his home, where he could swear he'd see his parents were in. However, the door was locked. He tried knocking and kicking the door, but they never responded to him. After several minutes of trying to get their attention, Ray realized that he was officially locked out. They must've thought that they would've all starved if they kept feeding him! At least, that was one point of view to have. Another point of view was that they grew greedy and were sick of sharing the food with him!

Once he realized he couldn't get in anymore, he sat down at the front door to his home, burying his head into his knees in a show of depression. He took a few moments to take solace in his unfortunate condition, not even paying attention to his grumbling belly for a few moments. But, soon, he decided that he couldn't just sit here. Maybe his starved body would terrify his parents, but he didn't feel like wasting away, not now! No, he'd have to survive. He got up, and looked back at the front door sadly, before walking away.

Now the question was, does he want to go back, or is he too mad to see them again? Is he gonna try to make things better for his family so he can live at home again, or is he gonna stay away from them and make a living for himself?
12211.title: Male

122111.content:
Ray may've been upset at his current circumstances, but he understood that they're worried too. Surely they wouldn't have done this if the situation wasn't so dire, right? Ray decided that if he were to solve this issue, then he'd have to make sure his family had enough food to make it, even if he lived with them! Unfortunately, that might be easier said than done. Everyone else is struggling due to the recent drought, and many of them are gonna be more inclined to hoarding the food for themselves.

However, recently a guild has entered town. This guild promises to help out the residents of Juniper Town, from making sure there's a steady supply of food here, to potentially finding out the cause of this drought. He figured these guys might be able to help out his family, though just looking at them earlier, Ray noticed that there were already many Pokémon running towards them asking for help. The Riolu already doubted that he'd be able to get a request in for his family in a timely manner, let alone wait long enough for the food to arrive. If he were to make a difference with those guys, then maybe he'd have to work alongside them and get some compensation...

He also heard rumors about an underground market hoarding some food in anticipation for the eventual famine. They seemed to expect to make a lot of money out of whatever they can scrounge up. Ray might not have a lot of money right now, but maybe if he could find that market soon, he could either get the food at a discount, or maybe he could work out a deal? Heck, they were bad guys, maybe he could get away with taking some of their food for himself?

Or, heck, those guild guys were probably gonna grab some food from a different area to keep the area safe. What'd stop him from taking some of that food himself? He heard of a forest far west, though the citizens seemed weary about going that way. It's a long way away, there aren't a lot of rations for a travel, and some seemed to believe the path over held some dangerous outlaws. Few said what was actually in the forest, but it's apparently fairly fertile.

Ray had a few options available, but not a lot of time to do them. If he were to make a decision, he'd have to make it fast.
122111.title: Ray wants to find a surpluss of food to bring home

1221111.content:
Ray decided right now his best chance of getting some food was by working with this guild. Maybe they offered benefits after all? Guess there's only one way to find out. So, he decided to check out the oceanic guild, down at the southern edge of Juniper Town. These guys traveled by water, word has it that they rode in on the backs of a wailmers, multiple being used so that the guild can travel the waters to multiple locations at once. The crowd seemed to be thick here, but Ray needed to get through.

He immediately began shoving through the crowd, dragging his face past several butts and squeezing past several stomping legs. He got several nasty barks and snarls, but he didn't care to listen to them, right now, he just wanted a chance to come back home. He was soon at the front of the crowd, where he could see the guild leader himself, Slowking. He seemed to pose regally and waved to the shouting crowd, which only barely formed a line to a duo of Smeargles, them using their tails to jot down requests of whoever was at the front of the, by some definition, line.

But, Ray didn't need to deal with those guys. No, he kept charging in through the crowd, shuffling past several legs, and soon before one of the smeargles. But, before one of the angry Pokémon waiting their turn could bark at him, Ray ran past the smeargles and over to the waving Slowking. He ran and ran, his face soon close to the crowned, pink Pokémon's gut. He seemed surprised at the riolu's approach, and looked down at him curiously.

"Uh, hey kid," he said with a dopey voice. "You know there's a line, right?" There wasn't a trace of venom in the guild master's voice, more like genuine wonderment, like he actually wasn't sure if Ray knew he had to wait his turn. He heard the crowd of Pokémon shouting, each having waited to speak with the guild to get some work done. This made Ray feel uneasy about speaking with this guy, but he needed to speak to him.

"M-Mr. Guild master, I-" Ray started, kneeling down to him. But the Slowking gently placed a hand on the riolu's shoulder and guided him upwards.

"Please, call me Earl," the Slowking said as he stood the boy up. He rubbed the back of his head nervously, but continued his speak.

"Earl, I... I want to join your guild," he said.

"What?"

"My parents are in need of food. We've struggled to get meals, I haven't eaten since noon yesterday, my parents even kicked me out so they could get more food for themselves!"

"O-oh my!"

"Please, I need to get food so I can get home! I-I'll work with you guys if that's what it takes! I'll travel with you to get some of it! Just please, give me the chance to bring it home!" At that, Earl seemed kind of slow on the uptake, shuffling to the side so Ray was now facing his right side. Earl placed a hand on his chin in contemplation, considering the pros and cons of potentially hiring this boy. He let out a "hmmmm" of deep thought.

"You seem awfully young to be out in the field... And we do encounter some dangerous stuff out there..." He stroked his chin, "hmmmmm"-ing louder. "Then again, we could always use more hands, especially with how many people need help right now..." He gave a few more strokes, before turning towards Ray and speaking. "Alright, kid, how'd you like to be an honrouary member?" At hearing that, Ray's tail began wagging and he nodded his head.

"Yes! Yes please!" he said, clasping his hands together excitedly. Earl smiled at that, and gently patted his head. At the same time, another Pokemon approached Earl from behind him. It was a weavile, a lady with a cold demeanor and a scowl seemingly plastered on her face.

"I'll make sure this town thanks you for your services to this town." Earl then turned towards the Weavile. "Meg, why don't you show this boy to the Normal Rankers." The Weavile, apparently named Meg, nodded, and approached, holding out her hand to Ray. He nervously brought up her own hand, and placed it in hers. With that, she turned around and led Ray, the Pokemon crowd now back to focusing on the Sneasels before them.

Meg and Ray didn't speak. Meg didn't seem like the kind of lady to speak normally, and Ray felt too nervous to say anything to her. She eventually led him to a small inn the guild procured for their members. She opened up the door, and headed inside, where the smell of drunkeness instantly made Ray's nose crinkle up. He covered up his nose as Meg led him to one of the upper floors, where there'd be a few doors one'd use to sleep at. The rooms in this inn are notably more spacious than most, supposedly to accomodate some of the bigger Pokemon that show up.

As she guided him, he saw some of the doors had signs on them, each bearing a symbol. They each seemed to be a white ball, bisected by a black line, with a pair of gold wings on the sides, and a big circle in the middle of those balls. He only had the chance to really look at a few doors, there were more with other signs. However, the circle seemed to be of a different color on each door. He passed a door with a diamond-blue circle, a door with a gold-yellow circle, a circle with a gray-silver circle, and a circle with a bronze-green circle. Meg led him to a door with a lavendar circle.

"These rooms are divided by ranks," Meg said. "As a beginner, you'll be assigned to the Normal Rank room, where you'll find a medal shaped just like this door's symbol. Hold onto it, and the mission director will assign you accordingly. You'll also be able to bunk with likwise Normal Rank Pokemon. You can visit some of the higher rank rooms, though currently guildmembers are being chaperoned to make sure too many people aren't in one room, so make sure you sleep in your assigned room. The more work you do for the guild, the quicker you'll rise up the ranks. If you have any questions, leave it to your fellow Normal Rankers."

With that, she let go of Ray's hand and stepped away, heading towards the stairs and going down it, likely to meet up with Earl again. Ray looked around at the currently empty tavern, and then back at that "Normal Rank" door. He guessed he'd have to get used to this. Though he was appreciative of the temporary home, he kept in mind that this wouldn't be permanent. He just has to do this long enough to get food to his family. With a breath in, followed by a breath out, he grabbed the handle, and opened it up.

Past the door, the first Pokemon he sees is...
1221111.title: Try to join the guild

12211112.content:
Ray opened up the door and were greeted with a strangely muscular little guy like himself. He had dark black fur on his torso, a lighter black fur around his legs like a pair of pants, and white fur on his head. The Pokémon turned around, and Ray was looking at a face with black-ringed eyes, and a mouth that looked like it was conditioned to look condescend to Pokémon. He confidently put his hands on his hips.

"Ah! They finally sent me some boy to back me up!" he said. "Now, how many punks have you beat up?" That made Ray's eyes widen.

"Beat up?" Ray repeated. At that, the Pancham sighed, rubbing his forehead.

"Oi, you're really new, aren't you?" the Pancham said. "Well, lucky you, you got yourself the toughest Normal Ranker here!" He then wrapped an arm over Ray's shoulders, pulling him in close. "Now, why don't we head out and see what you can do? We can train you out in the field, the wild is the best teacher!"

"Uh, I-I guess so?" Ray said.

"Good! Now, let's get you down and get you a and me a job. My knuckles have been itching for a fight!" The Pancham then began to lead the Riolu down the stairs. "Other Normal Rankers are out training or doing some other job. You'll get to know your fellow workers when we get back." Ray soon found himself down to the floor level, and the Pancham leading him to the cellar the inn's drinks were stored. And down there, he could see a desk set up among the wine racks. And behind that desk was an Abra, him managing the job list. He turned his head towards the duo.

"Hello, Bruno," the Abra said. "Nice to finally see you come down here finally."

"Blame the guild," the Pancham apparently named Bruno said. "They didn't give me a buddy for as long as I've been here." At that, Ray looked at Bruno curiously.

"I thought you said you fought for the guild?" he asked.

"Well, not while employed," Bruno said. "Anyway, Stevie? What've you got?" The Abra apparently named Stevie nodded. He then used his psychic powers to pull up a file with that Normal Rank symbol stamped on its front. He then opened it up, and Bruno was looking at a few jobs.

"Helping farm fields? Litter control? Pfff, what, do you want me to walk some old lady across the street next?" Bruno asked sarcastically. He then began searching through a few of the jobs, as if cherry picking for a particular one. He plucked a few, and hopped down, holding them excitedly. "Check these out! These look like they have some punks we gotta pound!" Definitely seems like Ray was gonna get roped into a fight anyways. He sighed and looked down at the missions.

-This one says that there's a band of Noibats that linger within the closest forest. When Pokémon try to snatch food from it, it's said these guys snatch up those travelers, do who knows what, and then toss them far from the forest. Victims are reported to either be wet or stinky. Or both. The client here asks for the Noibats to be driven far away.
-A Tyrunt has been seen chomping on rocks nearby. It wouldn't be a problem normally, except around the time the Tyrunt began eating, several Roggenrolas have been reported as missing. The client asks that Pokémon make sure this Tyrunt isn't eating Pokémon, and if he did, then to make him stop.
-A Midnight Lycanroc is leading some Rockruffs in a pack of thieves. Juniper Town has sent requests for caravans to send food and seeds, but this pack has intercepted them and stolen their goods. These punks need to be gotten rid of!
-A Slurpuff is giving off an obnoxiously sweet smell downtown. Not to mention how much she likes to grope Pokemon. She calls it cuddling, but there are many reports of her hands grabbing places they shouldn't. And then there's the licking- She needs to get out before she ends up slurping up some Pokemon

12511.content:
It was once or twice a day that the Pokemon nearest to the town’s train track were treated to the sound of the cute, quaint little trains gently chugging along towards the station. Most of the times, they just bring food to feed all the hungry bellies of the town. Other times, though, they bring a fresh load of passengers and new faces to the humble village of Juniper Town.

The train’s horn let out a cute toot-toot as it slowly slid to a stop at the train station, its many moving steel parts creaking to a stand still. It clicked and clanked and settled where it was for a while… before finally, one of the thick wooden doors slid open by themselves… revealing a chubby flygon! He was dressed in a fancy tweed vest and a matching bowler hat, looking out nervously over the town as he stepped onto the platform.

Well, here we are. Juniper Town. New beginnings. No need to be so anxious, Samuel… everything will turn out just fine here…

You, the flygon in question, try to think soothing thoughts to yourself as you meander off the train station, immediately almost being overwhelmed with just how many Pokemon of all shapes and sizes there were chatting and walking around! You had grown up in a small little town in the mountains, so having to squeeze your way through such crowded streets was new to you!

You gave sheepish smiles and little greetings to the Pokemon your chubby form accidentally bumped into, as you attempted to navigate your way through the large town. You had just come from Woodruff Village, after you felt like trying to find a new life in a larger town would be the best way to pursue your dreams…

First things first, though. You have to find a place to stay for at least the night. You have a satchel thrown over your shoulder which contains food, clothing, and seventy-five pokés, which would be enough to rent a room for a week back in Woodruff Village.

Eventually, you stumble into the cheapest, smallest little inn you could find, panting a bit in relief as you finally escape the bustling crowds. You nervously adjust your vest as you glance over into the eyes of the massive, fat purugly behind the counter, glaring at you with a severely unimpressed look.

“Ummm… hello, miss!” You give her a sheepish smile as you take a step closer, sweat dripping down your forehead. “I’m new to this lovely town, and I was just thinking of inquiring as to how much a room would cost for the night?”

“A hundred-fifty pokés,” she growls, simply.

“Oh… oh dear…” You’re a little taken about. A hundred fifty a night…? Back in your village, an inn like this would be closer to ten! Your anxiety spikes as it fully dawns on you just how much more expensive everything around here was going to be…! “Hmm. I shall be back!”

You stumble out of the hotel, thinking. You had to make at least enough money to sleep somewhere for the night. After that, you could find long-term options… “Now, where can one find employment around here on such short notice…?” You said, munching on a poffin from your satchel to calm your nerves… until your eyes suddenly happen to land on a big wooden board nearby! “Oh! The help wanted board! Of course!”

You trotted up to the board, looking over all of the assignments that you could do in just this afternoon, all of which would give you just enough to get that inn room for the night. Hmmm… there’s a job from a delphox whose daughter wants to learn to be a chef, and needs a taste tester… and one from the eating contest, who needs someone to announce each contest...
12511.title: New Face in a New City

choices: Your job is finished! Time for your reward.
You still have more food that needs tasting!
125111.content:
You wanted to take the taste tester just purely out of a desire to help this student learn. Totally! It’s definitely not just because you’re unable to resist the prospect of free food or anything! No way! Although… you do have to wonder if the chef-in-training’s recipes are going to be any good…

You were a little surprised they would invite strangers into their home, but you figure that the Pokemon around this town must just be very trustworthy. You stretch out your wings, taking the opportunity to fly over to the address listed on the board, happy to get off the crowded streets… though, you noticed, even the sky was a little crowded with flying Pokemon!

Eventually, you finally landed at that humble little home on the outskirts of town, bustling with that Juniper Town charm. You couldn’t help but smile at the beautiful, quaint decorations as you trotted up the steps, and knocked gently on the front door.

You heard movement within… and before you knew it, a sizable delphox lady pulled the door open with a knowing smile! Your cheeks went a little red as you paused for a moment. She was quite on the large side herself, with a big, round, soft-looking belly, along with incredibly wide, perfectly shaped hips…

“Oh, good afternoon!” She grinned warmly down at you while you took a moment to compose herself, trying not to stare at her pudgy, perfectly curvaceous body. “What can I help you with?”

“Oh, uh, actually…” You wring your hands nervously, having trouble meeting her gaze what with those beautiful, piercing eyes of her’s. “I’m here about that… taste testing job… on the town message board…?”

Her eyes lit up with recognition. “Aaaah! Of course! I’ve been waiting for quite a while for someone to answer that! My daughter is quite excited!” She reached out, her warm hand shaking her. “My name is Lola! Your’s?”

“Uhh… Samuel,” you nod, as you sheepishly trot into her home, looking around at just how cozy everything seemed to be. “You have a… wonderful home, miss…”

“Aww, why, thank you! It’s nice to meet you Samuel. Of course, you should meet the little chef-to-be, too!” She smiled, cupping her hands around her mouth before shouting. “Opal! The taste tester is here!”

Suddenly, you can hear little excited running upstairs… and before you knew it, an cheerful, young braixen was trotting quickly down the hall, wearing the cutest chef’s hat! Before you knew it, she had grabbed your hand, vigorously shaking it! “Oh my goodness! I’ve been waiting forever for another one since the last time! It’s so nice to meet you!”

You shake her hand, but you can’t help but feel a little nervous. You’re surprised nobody else would’ve gone for a taste testing job, after all this time. Did these two have a reputation? You couldn’t contemplate that for long, though, as Opal was already leading you deeper into the house. “We’ve got to get to work right away, sir! I’ve got so many recipes I need to try!”

Meanwhile, the girl’s mother just giggled. “Have fun, you two!” With that, you were led deeper into the house by the much smaller ‘mon, before being pushed onto a big, comfortable chair in the dining room.

“Alright, just wait right here, sir! I’ll cook all of the tastiest treats you’ve ever eaten in a jiffy!” The braixen seemed endearingly excited about cooking, leading you to calm down a bit, sitting in that chair and admiring the house around you as she trotted off to the kitchen.

Before you knew it, a delicious fragrance was wafting from the kitchen as she cooked! Smelling it, you couldn’t help but drool, your belly grumbling loudly. You haven’t had a big, proper meal all day! And it seemed that was what you were going to get… as the braixen soon trotted back, happily carrying a tray of food in either hand!

“Here you go, sir! Hot out of the oven!” She smiled, setting down each tray on either side of you, adorned with all sorts of various assorted foodstuffs. “Just lemme know how much you like each recipe, from one to turn!”

You nod to the young girl, but gently picking up a berry stew, and slurping it up contemplatively. To your relief, it was, indeed, quite delicious! It all slid down your throat before you even knew it, leaving you to lick your lips, cooing at the flavor. “Oooh! That was a good one! I’ll give it an 8.”

“Cool! Now here, try these poffins!” Before you could even react, the braixen was already shoving poffins down your paw! Just about the time you managed to swallow one of them, another one was already being shoved past your lips!

“I give it a eig- mph! An eig- MPH!” You keep trying to squeak out responses, but she doesn’t even give you any time before excitedly shoveling more food right down your gullet! “O-Opal! Think you might slow down- mph!”

The only reason you don’t really try to stop her was the fact that the food was so good it lured you into a trance, almost. You were starting to realize why most Pokemon avoided this job… she cooked so much food, and was so dedicated to feeding it to you, that you knew you were going to gain a ton of weight just from this meal alone!

Luckily, the trays were soon empty, and she ran off, giving you some time to breathe. You sigh, looking down and poking your now huge, rounded tummy, feeling it slosh and heave as the food inside shifted around. You thought it was over… until the young Braixen came back with even more trays of food!

“Haha, hey, uh, you might wanna slow down there, Opal. I don’t know if I wanna get too stuff- mph!” You just barely managed to squeak out a protest before she got right back to feeding you, and you could feel your stomach churn as it struggled to contain the massive meal! You were only halfway through the buffet!

Your stomach just kept growing, and growing, and growing, bigger than it’s ever been before as she stuffed it more and more, giggling with giddy excitement all the while! You were just focusing on the test, trying to weather the storm of the extreme buffet! Eventually, she finally ran out of food to feed you, and you take a deep breath of fresh air.

“There you go! All of my recipes! How were they?” She smiled, her tail wagging cutely as she looked expectantly up at you, hoping you’d like her cooking! You sighed, looking down at your huge, round belly, wondering how it even managed to fit all that food in there.

“It was a… ten,” you eventually relent, unable to stay mad at her cute face.

“Yay! I knew it! I think I’m ready to be a real chef! Thank you, mister!” She smiled, jumping forward and hugging you… but as you did, your belly let's out a big sloshing noise as it was jiggled, only causing her to giggle even more as she starts kneading the firm softness. “Wow, your tummy is sooo big and squishy now!”

“Yeah, that’s cause you’ve stuffed it to the brim…!” You pout! She didn’t take your annoyance too seriously, though, as she started to climb right onto your huge belly! “Wha… hey! Get off there!” You tried to take her off of your stomach, but it was too big for you to reach your arms around!

You were left utterly helpless as the braixen starts happily jumping up and down on your huge, bouncy, squishy gut, causing it to slosh and jiggle like crazy with every jump! “Hehe! Wheee!” She was cheering, celebrating her culinary victory with a nice bit of trampoline bouncing!

“H-hey! I didn’t sign up to be used as a trampoline…!” You protest, only to pause when her bouncing starts to bring up gas! “Uuuurrppp!” You let out a sudden belch, a reminder of the sheer amount of food packed away into your surprisingly stretchy gut!

Eventually, you just give up all together, exhausted from your buffet and just slumping back in your chair and letting yourself be used as a simple belly trampoline. “Urgh… this is not what I was expecting when I took this job…”

…

Some time later, you were roused from your stupor by the sound of someone approaching. It was that fat delphox lady, who walked in and smiled when she saw you, huge and stuffed to the absolute brim, with the braixen happily napping sprawled out on your huge belly as if it was just a bed. “Well, I see you two had fun!” Lola giggled.

“Well, she did…” You pout. “But you didn’t tell me I was going to get this stuffed!”

“Well, that’s part of being a taste tester!” The delphox smiled, reaching forward and laying a hand against the distended skin of your overly stretched-out belly. “If there wasn’t any difficulty about it, Pokemon would be lining up around the block just for the free food!”

You sigh, shrugging. “Yeah, I guess…” You say. “So… is that all you needed?”
125111.title: A Huge Buffet from a Junior Chef!

125411.content:
The city plaza was alight with the sound of dozens of uncanny voices, looking gleefully into the cold night, singing in unison backed by a choir of stuffed bellies churning and desperate, muffled cries.

The stars were the only light that hung over Juniper Town, a usually bustling town that tonight seemed almost frozen in time, its streets empty and placid. The only sound on the streets was the faint tune of waves breaking on the shore, the wind blowing back creaky signs… and of course, the rancor of that macabre congregation. In the center of town, Pokemon of all shapes and sizes were dancing and baying and laughing, gathered around a campfire as they sung, and sung, and sung their terrible song…

The remaining inhabitants - those who haven’t either been evacuated or lost their minds completely - huddled away in their darkened homes, their doors and windows barricaded, trying to do their best to block out that terrible sound. Some of them were haunted by the knowledge that it was their family and friends singing in that congregation… and some of them were haunted by the knowledge that it was their family and friends digesting away in those countless gurgling guts.

Damico was one of the lucky ones, more or less. The absol had been new in town; he didn’t know any of the Pokemon that have become victims of this dreaded curse. It had been around noon when he heard a scream coming from the town plaza, and before even bothering to see what exactly was going on, he had already ducked into a nearby general store to hide away. This decision ended up saving his life, as he discovered when he peeked out a window to witness the carnage unfolding in the center of town.

It seemed like dozens of Pokemon had gone mad! Their eyes glowing a deep shade of yellow as they ran laughing and hollering from the streets, chasing other Pokemon down and… well… swallowing them whole! Seeming to revel in those squirming bulges stretching out their necks as they happily devoured random townsfolk like meals, or toying with them in their maws and teasing their prey by dangling them just above their cavernous throats, before letting gravity slide them down in a single gulp.

Only a few Pokemon managed to run in and hide away in the general store before they barricaded the door. “W-w-we’re all gonna diiiieeee-hie-hieeee!” One of them, a delibird, was sobbing into her flippers, sat on a desk. She was crying… loudly. Too loudly. Damico was staring daggers at her, but she wouldn’t taking a hint. “We’re gonna get… get… GURGLED…!”

“We’re not going to die, Marla,” the shopkeeper, a manectric, mournfully shook his head as he patted her on the back, trying to calm her down mostly so her crying doesn’t lure those predators to their hideout. “The guild’s doing everything it can to fix all this. Once they’re done with the evacuation effort, they’ll surely send in teams to save our skins. You’ll see.” You thought that, too… but you’re starting to doubt it. It’ll take those predators an average of 24 hours to digest their prey, but once they do, they’ll have room for more… and they started over 12 hours ago, so time is running short...

“This is all that damn jolteon’s fault,” insisted a more cranky cinccino, his arms crossed in the corner as if this was all an annoyance to him. “I told you all, you can’t trust fancy new technology like those weird instruments of her’s! It’s dangerous! But did anybody listen to me? No, of cooouuurse not. Nobody EVER listens to Randy…”

“Alright! Let’s just… look, we need to calm down, okay? There’s nothing we can do other than wait to be rescued…” The manectric stood up all of a sudden, seeming frustrated with the situation. “Listen, I’ve got some sleeping bags in the back… why don’t we just call it a night? Get some much-needed rest. Sound good…?” The room was silent. Nobody, not even the delibird, had a problem with that plan. It was long after midnight, and they exhausted as could be…

But even in their dreams, they would find no reprieve. Their restless nightmares would be haunted by visions of that… concert. The concert that started this whole mess. Just a travelling band setting up their stage in the middle of town. Three of them were robed figures, making it impossible to tell just what species they were supposed to be… but one, their lead singer, was a jolteon glam rocker, with a fancy high-tech electric guitar she powered with her own electricity! Damico had to admit, she looked pretty damn cool… but the longer they played, the more Pokemon crowded around the stage, as if mesmerized.

It wasn’t until the concert reached its encore, though, that things really went south. With a laugh, that strange jolteon gal let out one last powerful shred with that guitar… and the audience members, well… in that moment, they just… changed. Their eyes glew a golden yellow, their demeanors became so much more feral and unhinged, and overall, they became a single, functioning unit with only one goal; to devour as many Pokemon as possible! What ensued was a display of such gluttony and hedonism, none of them would ever forget it...
125411.title: Time To Face The Music

13.content:
Not every Pokemon in this world is friendly! Some are completely feral, living without any sense of morals at all... and some are just selfish, and only think for themselves! Eventually, these folks can wrong enough Pokemon that a sizeable bounty is placed on their head, officially designating them as outlaws. They're wanted dead or alive, so to keep themselves safe, bandits tend to travel in groups, setting up camps, ambushing caravans, and raiding houses. You can be almost any Pokemon you want here, and you'll likely be a lot more powerful than any average citizen.

Speaking of which, what species of Pokemon would you want to be?

133.title: Liepard

choices: She wrapped her mouth around him
She dragged him back to camp
1332.content:
Many citizens in Juniper Town advised against traveling to the outskirts, for fear of some dangerous outlaws. However, there are a few that ignore those orders, either because they're too young to comprehend the danger, or they're sick of staying in town all the time, or they're looking for something on the outskirts... maybe a few are even enamored with the danger. As for the Espurr stepping out of town, he grew sick of the very strict practices his parents kept him under. They wanted to make sure he kept proper posture, always walked at a specific pace, always at in a specific way... He wanted to keep away from his mom and dad and just use this moment to really stretch his muscle. Already he was beginning his rebellion, increasing the pace of his steps and decreasing at seemingly random intervals, all while swaying side to side.

He was getting farther and farther from the village, all the better to keep away from his parents after all. He also made sure to leave under the cover of night so his dark fur would blend in more. He didn't seem to understand just how dangerous this was... so maybe it was time for a reminder.

He was soon a good mile away from the town gates, and he could see, on top of some grass beside the path, there were several large rocks Pokémon used to lounge about on their hike. The Espurr decided it was time to rest his little feet, so he stepped off the path and towards one of the large rocks, being forced to leap up so he could land butt first on it. He sighed and began massaging his paws a little, trying to calm them down. He took a moment to suck in some fresh air, air untainted by the many citizens cluttering the town. He sniffed some more, closing his eyes to enjoy the loneliness. However, as he sniffed, he picked up anther scent... He didn't recognize that smell, so his eyes opened up curiously, and he began scanning around.

"You seem lost, little one~" he heard a voice say. It sounded feminine, and had a certain purr to it. The Espurr's head snapped around, trying to get a reading on where that voice came from.

"N-no!" he declared. "Who are you?!"

"Now, now, you're the stranger here, I think I reserve the right to ask a few questions," he heard. "You say you're not lost, eh? What brings you out here?"

"I-I was trying to be alone," he answered, now standing up on the rock and looking around, looking out for this weirdo. He was met with a soft chuckle.

"Alone?" she said with a tone of bemusement. "Why would you want to be alone out here? Hasn't mommy and daddy told you about the monsters lingering out here?" This time, he thought he heard a rustle in the grass, likely a sneaky creep. He turned towards the grass, and held his hands to his temples, preparing a psychic attack. He focused on the place that rustling grass came from, summoned up the psychic energy of a Confusion strike, and centered it on that point. However, he didn't feel the attack connect with anything.

"I tend to have my crew with me, but, to be honest, sometimes I find I'm my own best friend~" He then saw something rise up out of the grass, it uncomfortably close to the rock field. She was a fairly big feline, the back of her coat being a dark purple, dotted with yellow rosettes. She also seemed to bear pink marking around her eyes akin to domino mask. Her under fur was more yellow, the purple around her fur ending around the ankles to giveway to yellow fur. Most people in Juniper Town would recognize this as a Liepard. This particular one was known as Mercedes, a wicked outlaw.

She stepped closer, and the Espurr attempted another psychic attack, only for another rustle of grass to attract him. Looking towards it he saw... another Mercedes? Another noise came from behind him, and again, he saw Mercedes. Mercedes here, Mercedes there, Mercedes everywhere, nearly forming a ring around them. He summoned up his confusion powers, and frantically struck one of them, only for them to fade into darkness as if they never existed. He turned towards another approaching one and attempted again, but it disappeared too. He kept trying to hit them, but they each seemed to just fade at the attack.

Before he could pull off one more strike, the Liepards faded away, all except for one, which leapt up and rammed a forepaw into the Espurr's chest, shoving him down and pinning him against the rock beneath. He squirmed about, kicking his legs and trying to lift her leg with his hands. He kept struggling even as she chuckled. Then, she leaned down, lolling her tongue out of her mouth, and dragged it up his face, causing him to shiver with disgust as her saliva stained him.

"Tasty~" she cooed out.
1332.title: Mercedes, illusionist extraordinaire

choices: A rescue team from the guild arrives
13322.content:
Mercedes gave the Espurr another lick and slowly dragged her tongue across his fluffy chest until it stopped at his cheek, giving her captive a clear view of the inside of her mouth. By all means she was planning on eating the little Pokemon but she suddenly realized who this Espurr was, or rather, who his parents were. They were two pedantic Meowstics that lived in the town that were obsessed with their social image in the eyes of the other townsfolk that also just so happened to be quite wealthy. During the times she infiltrated the town to purloin some goods their house stood out as being more lavish than the others but she never had the opportunity to break in.

A moment ago she was ready to clamp her jaws down and make a quick meal out of this Espurr but now a much better idea was forming in her mind; one that would end up getting her much more food. After dragging her tongue across the rest of his face she closed her mouth and smiled down at the smaller Pokemon. The Espurr mumbled as he worked up the courage to speak to her. "Are- Are you going to eat me?" He fearfully asked.

She stifled a chuckle. "No, I think I've got a better idea," she said. Releasing her paw from her captive she was happy to see that the he knew he was defeated. It was something Mercedes found happened a lot to the Pokemon she beat; they just lie still and hope she goes away, or perhaps they know resisting was futile. The Espurr let out a yelp when she batted him with a paw and made him roll over onto his belly. Mercedes leaned down and slowly whispered into his ear. "Please don't make me change my mind."

With that she bit down on his exposed neck and lifted him up. The Liepard had already formulated a plan for the lone Pokemon in her jaws as she set off for the direction of her camp. She was going to put the Espurr up for ransom! Based on what she had seen and heard of the Meowstic family they were wealthy and if they truly valued the life of their child they would definitely pay up for his release. The terms will be simple; a large sum of Poké that they could realistically pay, no contact with any other Pokemon, meeting at her desired location and a time limit of one day.

She continued wandering through the dark forest, intermittently increasing the pressure her jaws had around the Espurr's neck whenever he started to protest. The Espurr groaned as she took him deeper into the forest, unsure of where he was in relation to the town as she took bends and turns seemingly at random. Before long the light of a small campfire began piercing through the trees as she approached her camp. Being outlaws, they could not afford the luxury of a permanent residence and instead had to resort to occasionally moving their staging area. Either way, the mess of tents and equipment was what Mercedes could call home.

She could see her comrades all sitting around the campfire laughing and exchanging jokes. Around the fire were outlaws just like her; a large Serperior, a reserved Honchkrow, a brooding Zoroark and a strong Mightyena with his little Poochyena brother by his side. A flick of the Mightyena's ear told Mercedes that he heard her approaching and he was about to call out to her before he saw the mischievous look on the Liepard's face. By now the others were noticing her, too, all except the Poochyena. Silently she approached as all of them tried to continue their conversations while concealing their amusement.

Now practically standing right behind the oblivious Poochyena, Mercedes slowly eased the Espurr in her mouth forward until he was dangling right next to his face. The completely defeated Espurr was a miserable sight to behold but when Poochyena saw its large purple eyes right next to him he yelped and jumped in the air out of shock. A cacophony of laughter at his expense was triggered as he tried to compose himself. Mercedes dropped the Espurr to the ground and playfully reprimanded the shocked Poochyena. "You need to be more aware of your surroundings, Kip. Your brother heard me coming from a mile away."

Kip only let out an embarrassed groan before he sat back down. The laughter started to die down and the Mighyena, Harv, greeted her. "You're back, boss!" he exclaimed. "And I see you've brought a snack home?"

Mercedes gave him an innocent giggle. "No, we're not eating this one. I found him all by his lonesome and I was lucky enough to remember that this one comes from a very wealthy house. If they want him back they're gonna have to pay~"

"That's why you're the boss, boss!" the female Serperior praised. "You make the best plans."

"Mhmm," Mercedes hummed as she looked over her crew. Despite being leader the Liepard was actually the latest member of the small band of misfits. When she came across the group their leader was an Espeon that had apparently decided Mercedes was a good target to rob and in the heat of the moment she challenged him to a one-on-one fight with the stakes being leadership of the group. While he was surprisingly tough to beat, she won and decided to display her dominance in the most dramatic way she could think of; eating him alive. It was extremely difficult getting him down but in the end his struggling form was securely trapped in her belly, bulging on display for all to see.

Her intention was to single out the leader and make sure his underlings knew not to mess with her but they all took the stakes of the match to heart and warily accepted her as being their new leader. On a whim, she accepted it, too. Usually being a loner, Mercedes was out of her element but she quickly picked up how to lead the small crew and worked hard to earn their trust and respect. Now they were like a family to her.

Mercedes regarded the Espurr at her feet and spoke up. "We're going to write up a ransom letter for this little guy and get it delivered tonight. If they fail to pay up then I guess we're just gonna have to eat him." Mercedes could already see the Honchkrow, Crowley, ready with pencil and paper. "Good," she said. Sitting next to him she explained what to write on the paper; the ransom price, the location, the deadline and the terms to come alone. The entire crew was peeking over her shoulder as she proof-read the letter.

"Is that all your asking for?" the Zoroark asked. "I mean, it's a lot but couldn't we get more?"

"If we ask for too much then they'll be forced to ask for help. If they can pay for it themselves then they probably won't seek help if it means protecting their family's 'perfect' image from being tarnished and result in a quick and easy transaction with no retaliation from the guild."

The crew all hummed in understanding. "That's why you're the best, boss!" Harv cheered. Mercedes rolled the letter up and passed it to Crowley who firmly grasped with one of his talons.

"You know where to drop it?" she asked. The Honchkrow merely nodded before he took off in flight. Mercedes was confident in her plan but as any experienced leader would, she still felt worried about the outcome. Having devised numerous plans during her time as the group's leader she knew to expect the unexpected. It was entirely possible that the Meowstic family might defy her expectations and simply contact the guild that recently showed up in town but she was hoping it would not come to that. If it worked, though, she and her crew would be able to afford a whole entire feast and more!

"Now we wait," Mercedes said as she turned to the Espurr. He was sitting next to the fire with a grim expression on his face that made her almost feel sorry for him. She decided everyone would take shifts sleeping to make sure he doesn't try and run away in the night and then move to the meeting spot in the morning. What would happen after that is up to the Meowstic family.

1422.title: Excadrill

choices: She steps out of line and looks for a job herself
She takes a job from Sweeny anyway
14222.content:
While many members of the guild enjoyed sleeping on a calm bed and letting the soft surface whisk them to sleep, there are a few that prefer to sleep in their element. Some of the water types like sleeping in warm water, some of the grass types like sleeping under leaves or in trees, and so on. The Pokémon of interest, a ground type meanwhile, tended to sleep in the ground. Burrowed into the dirt was a fairly large, fairly plump, mole-like Pokémon with dark brown fur and red markings, along with thick claws and a blade-like protrusion from her forehead. This was an Excadrill, a proficient digger and proficient devourer. She's also kind of notorious for her smell, spending her nights sleeping in the dirt and whatnot.

This was Libby, a lady that was working off some outlaw in her belly through the night. Later, though, with the daytime rising, she stirred awake. She stayed for a moment, trying to detect any movement in her gut. However, everything was silent. She sighed and gently patted her belly, a bit more pudge to her now.

"Mmm, enjoy your life sentence," she said. She then tried to back up, but her body refused to move. She strained and kept trying to squeeze backwards, but she was still stuck! She began to realize her belly fat was getting caught on the dirt walls she'd slept within. "Oh you're a fighter beyond the end, eh?" Libby brought one of her claws in front of her, and spread them, them emitting the sound of an unsheathed blade. And so, she began digging upwards.

Up above, near where she slept, there was a tree with a Gligar hanging from it from his tail, him looking down at the ground patiently. This was Simone, Libby's partner in the guild. He seemed to think she should be up soon, and he silently feared that what she ate might've messed her up during her sleep. However, soon the ground split open. He saw a familiar claw pop out, followed by another. With a grunt, Libby hoisted herself upwards, her body splitting more and more of the earth. So, she placed her feet up on the ground and stood up, her plump body now on display for the world.

"Ah, I gotta get used to bigger holes," she noted. She planted her claws around her enlarged gut and gently played with it, lifting it a little before letting go and letting gravity pull it down, jiggling as it flopped back into its original position. Upon seeing her get up, Simone got out of the tree and flew over.

"How'd that Electrike taste?" he asked before settling himself on her shoulder.

"Not the best thing I ate, but certainly not unpleasant." She patted her gut and looked up at her partner. She then stretched her body upwards, yawning while she did so, and smacked her lips together as she scratched her back. Then, she began to walk back to the meeting point of the guild. She rode the boat over, and she hated every moment of it. She wasn't built for the water, she just needed to stay on the soil. Ah well, at least she wouldn't have to deal with water for a while while over here. At least not until they deal with whatever brought upon the drought. She ruled the soil, and she'd make sure her girth ruled any small outlaw.

Soon, she was back at the meetup point, the boat's deck. She stepped up onto it, and stood near the guild member, a few Pokémon picking up her scent and scooting away from her. The Pokémon appeared to be taking their missions from Juniper Town, the town in danger. There was the guild member, a Swampert known as Roy, and next to him was the designated job delegator, a Pidove named Sweeny. Libby stood in line and waited for her turn to receive a job. She looked down at her badge, still a Normal Rank. She sighed inwardly. She felt the need to fill her belly up with bigger meals, but she'd need more points before she can graduate from the small fry.

Then again, she didn't need to wait for Sweeny to direct her. Surely there's some townsperson that had to deal with a bigger threat, right? Maybe one of them could use her help.
14222.title: Female

choices: She spies their caravan on the way to the valley
She makes it to the valley and finds them
142222.content:
Libby looks over her badge, and then peeks out towards Juniper Town, considering stepping out. Simone, meanwhile, sat on her shoulder, and realized what she was considering.

"I know the last guys didn't exactly pose a challenge," Simone began. "But we can't simply step away from Sweeny here. If we don't turn in an officially assigned job, we won't get points. Meaning that even if you do a favor from someone in Juniper Town, you'll just have to take another job anyway to get tougher jobs." At hearing that, Libby considered her options. She then groaned, slumping backwards a little as she groaned.

"Fine," she huffed out. "More official jobs, the sooner we get to the big fries." Simone nodded at that, and so Libby slumped forwards, an upset expression on her face as the line slowly moved forwards... It seemed she was only half way through the line and she already felt like she was taking forever. All she wanted was to find some puny Pokémon to pummel, and this pausing line was taking longer and longer for her to get that goal. Though, she figured she might as well check out her body right now... She lifted an arm and sniffed underneath, paying no mind to the Pokémon behind recoiling in disgust and covering their mouths and noses. She let out an "eh" and brought it down, deciding it gave her edge most of these prudes didn't have.

A little later, and she was 3/4 of the way through. She reached behind her and scratched her itchy back a little. She then tried to get more towards the center of her back, but she couldn't reach. Simone saw this and flew behind her, using his claws to gently scratch. She let out a nice sigh and bent forwards, her tongue lolling out as he scratched. She kept walking forwards as the line did, still enjoying her little back scractcher. Soon enough, the line in front of her was gone, and she approached Sweeny.

The Pidove backed away, his eyes shooting open at seeing her before the line. The same reaction as yesterday. He reached behind him, picking up a pole, and he stuck the mission statement in front of him to the end of it. He lifted it up, and held it up to Libby, just like yesterday. She plucked the mission statement from it, and walked away, sighing angrily at that. It's not her fault she was born for the dirt. Even now, for a few moments on the boat, she felt antsy on top of the water. With the mission in hand, she couldn't get off of this thing sooner. She was soon down on the soil, and let out a sigh of relief, flopping onto her belly and cradling the ground.

"What'd you get?" Simone asked, snapping her out of her own moment of reprieve. She sighed and sat up, not minding that her butt was parked right in front of the bridge from the ship to shore. She opened up the envelope the mission was in, and pulled out the letter, reading the details.

Missing Seeds


A group of Nuzleafs were gathering up berry seeds to plant somewhere. However, while they were searching, some rogues grabbed the cart holding the seeds and ran off with them towards some northern valley. If this mission arrives soon enough, those rogues will likely still be on their way there. Reported rogues are a sneasel, a pachirisu, a rockruff, and a munchlax.

Libby groaned and pocketed the letter.

"Buncha small fry stole some stupid seeds," she said.

"Well, those seeds might be important nowadays," Simone tried to argue.

"Yeah, yeah, I'll care about what's important soon as I can pummel it." Simone flew onto her shoulder, and she began her march towards the valley, seeking out these punks trying to act tough.
142222.title: She takes a job from Sweeny anyway

choices: She sends Simone to deal the first blow
She digs down to hit the wagon from below
She and Simone synchronize an attack to double team them
She charges the two Pokemon in the back
1422221.content:
Libby took the march to the valley on her own. Libby could've had someone help her get from place to place faster, but she preferred it this way. Sun beating on her back while she pushes herself to the limits, it helps her work up a sweat, and sweat makes it easier to pound those loser Pokémon. Simone learned to tolerate Libby, but even now she was threatening to drive him off. Still, he clung to her shoulder like a good friend where no one else would.

She wiped her brow, letting out a sigh as she stamped. She didn't seem to pay attention to any potential outlaws. The guys hanging around here weren't usually a big threat. She just had to sit on them or slam her gut on them and they'd be out of commission. Not that any of them dared approach. It just made her trip boring, at least if they showed up she could hear some puny jerk whine for mercy. She considered a game to pass the time...

"Quick, you name a Pokémon that'd piss me off," she said. Simone looked down curiously, until he remembered this game.

"Ah, that..." he said. "As you travel, you see some Pancham on the road, hoarding a bunch of performance enhancing supplies prescribed to specific Pokémon. He's currently distributing them among a bunch of other Pokémon his age-" His little spiel was interrupted by Libby cracking her knuckles.

"I'm gonna grab him by the wrist and pull him aside, tell 'im I have some serious words for him," Libby said.

"He seems shocked at first, and then begins pulling against your grip. He keeps trying to free himself."

"Then I'll just bring down my other arm and hoist 'im up over my shoulder."

"Now he's kicking his feet and banging his fists on your shoulder. Later, he tries to bite you to get free-"

"Oh he's in fer it now! I yank him off of me and roughly throw him onto the ground. There, I place my feet on the ground to the left and the right of him and order him to get into push up position."

"That Pancham isn't going to settle for that. He instead tries to crawl away."

"I gave that bug a chance! I throw my legs out from under me, falling ass first on him."

"You land on his back, causing the Pancham's eyes to shoot open as he's sandwiched between the floor and your backside."

"I cross my arms and tell him to lift me up, or else-"

"Hey I think I see them," Simone interrupted. Libby looked ahead, and further on the path, she can definitely see a wagon. She could see a rockruff and a munchlax pushing it while a sneasel and pachirisu sat on top, looking ahead.

"These little brats couldn't even get away fast enough!" Libby noted to herself with a laugh.

"We should probably be careful with these guys. I don't trust that sneasel in particular..."

"Fine, we'll knock those punks down, then we can beat them to our heart's content."

Fortunately, it seemed the rockruff and munchlax seemed to be pushing the cart at a slow enough speed. Libby figured she could take her time planning this out. Then again, she was hungry for a few squeals...
1422221.title: She spies their caravan on the way to the valley

14222213.content:
"Stay away from that sneasel boy," Libby said. "Don't worry about that Pachirisu."

"Who do you feel like venting your frustration on?" Simone asked.

"I'm feeling like giving that glutton a taste of some real girth."

"Dully noted." Simone stood on Libby's side and the pair began approaching the wagon from behind. Libby was keeping up a steady pace, not minding how much she stamped. After all, even from here the duo could hear the wagon grinding of the wagon's turning wheels. Awfully convenient. She was stamping, upping her speed. As she got closer and closer, she shook the shoulder Simone was on, signaling her. He then lifted his wings and lifted up. He flew up, and began to approach the Rockruff. He latched his legs around the dog Pokémon's waist, and then lifted up, carrying him away squealing and writhing. The other Pokémon looked towards the source of the squealing, jaws dropping. The Sneasel, however, got up to his feet and stood at the edge of the wagon. He began to charge up an ice beam, but the wagon was suddenly rattled!

Unknown to the rest of them, while Simone was flying off with his prey in his claws, Libby ran up behind the group. She got in close, pivoted, and suddenly rammed against the back of the wagon, smushing the Munchlax against the back and practically flattening him with her backside. The impact shook the wagon, and caused the Sneasel to trip up and fall off the wagon, roughly landing on the dirt. The Pachirisu barely stayed in his wagon, and the Munchlax was beginning to stand up, trying to shake off the cobwebs the impact left in his head. Unfortunately, while he was confused, Libby stood up, a malicious grin beginning to draw on her face. As disappointing as pounding some dweebs was, she had to admit there was some excitement to wearing some brat down into submission.

She cracked her knuckles and craned her neck left and right, her muscles audibly popping as she loomed over the Munchlax. She grinned as she readied her next attack.

She uses...

142222133.content:
Warning, Contains flatulence ▼

Libby glared down at the Munchlax, him still stunned by the horrific pounding from before. She giggled to herself as she felt something, a familiar stirring in her gut. She bent down and picked up the dazed Pokemon, holding him by the ankle and carrying him away from the wagon. Wouldn't want the goods to get in the crossfire after all. Mid-carry, she saw the Munchlax rouse awake, groaning as he realized he was being hoisted away.

"Hey little guy~" she cooed, keeping him at arm's length and high above the ground. "D'ya know who I am? I'm with the local guild. That means it's my job to beat up little troublemakers like you. Now I would normally gobble up little losers like you, but you're in luck. You looks like you're full of so much fat, my arteries'd probably get clogged licking you." The Munchlax began squirming about in Libby's grip, terrified about what the excadrill could do to him. His squirming seemed to quiet down when she said she wouldn't eat him, but he still seemed plenty afraid. Libby brought him close, close enough for him to smell her breath.

"Don't think that means you're getting off scott free," she said. "After all. I still have to give. You. A warning." She punctuated the latter half of her sentance with a taps to his nose. He leaned down a little and easily scooped up a chunk of the dirt, leaving an approximately Munchlax-sized hole in it. She then brought him down, maing sure he went feet first in, before quickly shoveling the dirt in place and leaving him pinned down, his head alone exposed. He squirmed around, grunting and groaning as he tried desparately to get out. His struggling was stopped when he looked ahead, and spied Libby's giant, round, chubby butt faing him, her bending over slightly.

"Remember! You asked for this!" she said, rubbing her growling gut. Then, she grit her teeth as the Munchlax thrashed around, trying to wedge himself free. Unfortunately, that'd be for not. With a quick grunt, the Munchlax was thrust into a horrific hell, a heat comparable to a furnace surrounding him while his mouth and nose were filled with a rotten, poisonous stench. With a pained cry, the poor Munchlax went limp, completely knocked out by Libby's attack. The crude Excadrill let out a rude laugh upon looking down at the boy, before she sauntered confidently towards the wagon.


Libby was coming back to the wagon, having dealt with one of those brats while Simone was carrying off another. The Pachirisu was rubbing her forehead while the sneasel boy was now beginning to stand up. Good for Libby. That chubby chump didn't quite sate her hunger. She came close to the wagon, and...
