1432.title: Quilava

choices: Ask Tobias to delegate you a mission
Go out and try and find your own mission
14321.content:
The steady hold slumber had on you was slowly shaken away by the constant bickering of your charmeleon partner. “I said get UP, lazybones! We’re gonna dock at that new village in, like, just a couple hours from now!” He complained, shaking you back and forth on the bed until, eventually, you can’t even ignore it.

“Urghrgh…” You let out a long, tired groan as you stretch out on the bed, yawning as you scratch your side, not even bothering to open your eyes. After all, the sun hasn’t even come up yet. “Willis… I’m tryin’ to conserve energy… for all that… adventuring we’re going to do…”

“And what? Are you just gonna sleep in and not get up in time for breakfast?” The thought of missing breakfast was enough to finally spur you to open your eyes, and bring your lazy, lethargic body crawling out of bed. “Yeah, that’s what I thought! Now get ready!” The charmeleon chuckled, as he had toward your quarter’s bathroom.

The ship you were on rocked gently in the waves as you brushed your teeth in the bathroom. Meanwhile, Willis was doing pull-ups at the door to get his blood pumping for the morning - something you used to do, too, but since, you’ve started to develop a bit too much… weight. “Heh! Can’t manage a single pull-up anymore, Oliver? Guess you really need to lay off the lava cookies~” He giggles, poking your tummy and causing it to wobble slightly.

“Makin’ fun of a Pokemon’s pudge is a good way to end up adding to it, you know…” You growl grumpily, your eyes half-lidded and making it clear that you were too tired to put up with anything this morning.

“Sorry to disappoint, Oliver, but you’ve gotta have two to make a team! So you’re stuck with me~” He leans forward and teases, only making you give him another sleepy glare. You’d never actually eat him, of course. Willis has been your best friend since you were little kids. You both trained hard so you could join the guild together. Of course, the fact that you knew eachother so well meant that he knew exactly how to annoy you…

Up on the main deck, the two of you settled in for breakfast along with dozens of other guild members, as the sun rose in the distance. “Man, I’m so excited, I like, can’t stop shaking!” Willis smiled widely at you, seeming to be rather cutely anxious for the day ahead. “Our very expedition… our very first missions… we’re gonna be real adventurers!”

You nodded inbetween bites of your breakfast. Indeed, your hometown had been visited by the guild previously, and the two of you had spent months training for it, trying to become part of its ranks. Luckily, you both managed to qualify for membership right before the massive ship sailed away again, on its way to some place known as Juniper Town.

“Mhmm! I mean, unless we get eaten by bandits or something…” You chuckle, in a much better mood now that you’ve had some time to wake up and eat.

Later still, the moment’s finally arrived. You all crowd onto the top deck of the ship, the day bright and the wind rippling through your fur, as you all cheer as the new lands finally come into view over the horizon! “Juniper Town…!” You gasp in awe, finally laying eyes on the beautiful, advanced little town built among countless hills, valleys and forests, looking completely in tune with the wonders of nature.

As the guild members all docked as the hulking ship approached the land, their focus shifted to the sound of the captain’s quarters loudly sliding open. Indeed, emerging was a massive, powerful, pudgy Blastoise, Walton - the captain of the exploration guild! You’d only ever seen Walton just a few times, and you were always in total awe of him! Everyone cheered when he walked out, which he tolerated for a while, before raising a hand, causing everyone to fall silent immediately.

“... so. After seven months on our previous expedition, and three weeks at sea, we are finally approaching a new land. A new town. A new fresh start,” he began, in a deep, authoritative voice. “To the Pokemon here, we are not a mere organization. We are a symbol of hope. And this must be the image we cultivate. While you shall be paid fairly for every mission completed, you mist remember your main goal is not profit, but working to ensure a hopeful future for every innocent Pokemon.”

“Juniper Town - the town you see before you - is a place that needs this hope. Rain isn’t falling, crops aren’t growing, and if this continues, Pokemon might start to go hungry in just a few months. Was it nor for us, it seems likely that this beautiful forest land would just dry up into a sprawling desert. But we’re not gonna let that happen, are we?” He asks, the corners of his lips curling up into a grin.

“Sir, no, sir!” The guild members all shout in unison.

“ Whatever’s causing this, we’re gonna track it down, kick its butt, and give these Pokemon a future worth looking forward to. Am I right?” He asks, louder.

“Sir, yes, sir!” Echoes across the sea.

“I thought so! Now we’re gonna try and make a good first impression immediately upon landing. Diamond Rank teams and above, focus on meeting and interacting with civilians. They’ll have heard legends of your adventures, so you’ll be like heroes to them. Gold rank teams and below, focus on solving whatever small little problems they need you to deal with. Prove to them that we’re here to help! My first in command, Tobias, shall lead your efforts. Have I made myself clear?” He raises a brow.

“Sir, yes, sir!” Everyone shouts one last time, loud enough to make their throats hoarse. With that, the satisfied blastoise returns to his quarters, and Tobias,a rather large and well-dressed vaporeon, trotted out.

As you all get to work, you glance down at your badge…

Team Foxfire
Oliver & Willis
Normal Rank

You sighed, always having wondered why it was called ‘normal rank’ when it was really just delegated to complete newbies. Hopefully, though, if you work hard enough, you might be silver ranked by the end of this expedition!
14321.title: Team Foxfire on their First Adventure!

143212.content:
It could be a little trickier going out and trying to find missions on your own, or so you’ve heard. Tobias makes sure that each mission offered to the guild goes through a strict vetting system, to ensure that it’s not a trap, and that it’ll actually pay fairly, while also ensuring that guild members can’t extort the villagers.

On the other hand, Tobias only collects missions sent to the guild, so it’s a more reactive approach. Going out and actively searching for problems to solve is the proactive approach, and it helps find obscure problems that have slipped through the cracks. Since this is your first day on the job, you want to go the extra mile…!

You nervously wring your hands as the boat stops at the docks and begins to drop its anchors, seeing the crowd forming down below. Once the massive ship was finally still, the guild members all began hopping off, ready to meet the curious townspeople come to investigate, chat, and register missions.

“You ready?” You turn to Willis for some comfort, only to find that he looks just as nervous as you now, under that bravado.

“Ready as I’ll ever be!” With a nod towards eachother, you both hop right off that ship, shuffling through the crowd of Pokemon that’s formed. The next minute was a blurry haze of squeezing past Pokemon, saying hello, and answering the occasional question. Luckily, most Pokemon lost interest in you when they realized you were just newbies.

Eventually, you finally made it off the docks, and took a knee to take a breath now that you finally had some personal space. You both had little bands around your neck with your guild badge on front, making it obvious that you were civilians, but luckily, most passed you by with nought but a curious glance.

“Welp, we’re here. Juniper Town! Our very first expedition!” Willis smiled, getting a little excited now that he was finally here. “There’s adventure around every corner! Like, that shopkeeper over there? I bet he’s dealing with a robbery problem! A mysterious thief… a bandit in the knight! Oh, or that nidoqueen! I bet she’s a mother, looking for her son, who’s been kidnapped by a tribe of-”

“Alright, alright, Willis! Don’t get ahead of yourself, here!” You pat him on the back, trying to calm him down, and he chuckles a bit, still rocking on his heels in excitement. “We’re just starting out, so we’re probably going to get the boring missions for now. We’ve just got to focus on helping out as much as we can, okay?”

He sighed, nodding and seeing your point. “Okay, okay. Sorry…” He shrugs. “... I hope we at least get to fight some yummy bandits, eventually…” You can’t help but agree with that. It’s been way too long since you’ve lost had a real Pokemon meal.

You both wander around the absolutely beautiful town, not really knowing how to find quests to do, and being too nervous to ask. Eventually, you both decide you should stop at a little cafe in order to calm your nerves… and because the smell of that delicious cooking was making your stomach growl.

“Ah! You must be two o’ those guild members I’ve been hearing about!” The HUGE, pudgy grumpig chef across the bar smiled at you as the two of you sat down, evidently recognizing your exploration guild badges. “Let me be the first to welcome ya to our humble little town! Can I get ya anything?”

“Oh, uh, thank you!” Willis spoke up, blinking at just how polite and friendly the grumpig was, despite being a total strange. “Yeah, I’ll have a Poke Puff Supreme Wish, and my friend here will have a…” He presses his ear against your belly, pretending to ‘listen’. “... a Watmel Berry, please.”

“No problem! Coming right up!” The big fat grumpig smiled, before turning and happily getting to work. As the two of you sat there, you suddenly heard another voice speak up.

“So… you two darlings are guild members, hmmm~?” You turned to see, to your surprise, there was a ninetales sitting right next to you! You somehow hadn’t even noticed him! And… well, if you hadn’t just heard his voice, you would assume he was a female. He definitely had an extremely feminine look about him, you immediately noticed, especially those half-lidded, alluring eyes.

Your eyes quickly trace down his body, and you noticed something else about him - his belly was big and bulging! He, apparently, had somebody wriggling around in there, squirming as it bulged and churned all around them. This normally wouldn’t be so strange, but…

The most notable thing about him was his rump! Even squished against the chair beneath him, you could see at a glance that it was just… absolutely huge! You’ve never seen a derriere that was so… soft, and… round, and… oh, you try to turn your head and look away before that line of thought could get awkward!

“Did you just call us… darlings?” Willis raised a brow, seemed to be a bit intrigued by just the strange way the ninetales was speaking. “Uh… well, yeah! We are guild members, actually! We’re, uh, normal rank, though.”

“Oh, how fun! I’ve always wanted to meet a guild member~” He smiled, leaning in close with the most strange and alluring smug expression on his face, and you were almost mesmerized as you stared into those glowing eyes. “If it’s not too much to ask… may I inquire about your services?”

Before you could even get in a word edgewise, Willis stood up on his chair and pushed your head down so he could look the ninetales in the eyes, obviously getting a little over-excited about the job offer! “For the right price, definitely!”

Before anybody could say another word, the grumpig brought three dishes - your’s and Willis’, as well as a hot stew for the ninetales. “Hot out the oven, guys! Enjoy!” The grumpig smiled, and everybody thanked him.

“Hmm. We shall discuss business over lunch, then!” The ninetales giggled, before reaching up and starting to gulp down the fancy stew before him. You and Willis join in, trying to clear your head as you swallowed big chunks of the watmel berry, already making your tummy bulge out a bit.

“Now, I just realized I hadn’t even introduced myself! My apologies. My name is… Sebastian!” The ninetales smiled, saying his name with some dramatic flair. “And I happen to run a little church, where I care for my many followers, and offer them… ‘spiritual guidance’.”

“Spiritual guidance, huh?” Willis raised a brow, incredulously.

“Oh, you. Some Pokemon out there feel lost and meaningless, and I… give them purpose. Help them… contribute to something,” he smiled warmly. “But just recently, our church has been burglarized! And I’m afraid those scandalous ne’er-do-wells ran off with a truly priceless artifact!”

“Outlaws, sir?” You ask, thinking it over. “What sort of artifact did they steal?”

“A life-sized golden sculpture of… well, my derriere,” he confessed, and both you and Willis immediately did a double take. “I am aware it sounds silly, but I assure you, it is important to the worship at my temple. For its return, I am willing to compensate you happily.”

You and Willis both looked at eachother, and having known eachother for so long, you knew exactly what the other was thinking. Willis was wondering if he really wanted his first mission to be recovering some giant golden butt. This ninetales seemed suspicious, too, and this whole church seemed backwards.

Meanwhile, you were more optimistic. This seemed like the perfect opportunity to help a citizen around this town! And besides, there was just something… alluring about the ninetales. It was like you wanted to… serve him.

Eventually, you both make a decision without even needing to speak...
143212.title: Sebastian the Extremely Curvaceous Ninetales

1432121.content:
“Sebastian, you’ve got yourself a deal!” Willis smiled as he downed the last of his delicious Pokepuff. By now, you were all filled with your meals, your plates lying empty before you.

“Ah, wonderful! I’m sure you boys are more than up for the task. Now, as a show of good faith, please allow me to pay for your meals,” Sebastian offered, with that alluring little smile of his again, apparently smug in your agreement.

“By all means!” The charmeleon smiled, hopping off of his bar stool with his belly rounded and sloshing, letting out a resounding belch. You blushed at just how crude your friend was, giving the ninetales an apologetic look as you hop off your own chair.

“My scouts have pinpointed their location in a little grove northeast of here. I can mark it on your map, if you wish.” Sebastian explained. Sure enough, you held up your map for him, and he marked an area with a little pen he held with his teeth. “There should be around 6 of the outlaws… one of them a roserade. Bring that one too me intact for an extra reward.”

There seemed to be some extra venom in his voice while he spoke of the roserade, which made you a little bit uncomfortable. But Willis thought nothing of it. “Alright, cool! We’ll handle it from here, Sebastian, no worries! C’mon, Oliver! We gotta get that statue before it’s too late!” With that, he trots off, his belly sloshing all the while… and with a sigh, you follow begrudgingly afterwards.

You hold the map while he takes point, trotting through the forest together as you navigate based on the many beautiful, natural landmarks scattered around. Eventually, your voice lowers to a whisper. “Alright. We should be getting close now,” you explain, and he stops in his tracks. “Let’s try to be sneaky about this, alright? See what we’re getting into.”

“Right!” He nods, a determined look on his face. As you approached the camp, you both crouched down to avoid making sound… and when you drew closer still, you started to crawl along the ground to avoid being seen. Eventually, a bandit encampment came into view exactly where the ninetales had marked.

You take the binoculars out of your bag and give the camp a lookover from your perch in the bushes. “Two nidoran, a gloom, a skiploom, a roselia, and that roserade he mentioned…” You count out the outlaws, almost holding your breath.

“Heh! Easy peasy!” He smiled. Since most of them are grass types, he figures this must be a piece of cake! But you have your reservations. You desperately want to make sure this goes well. You don’t want to end up gurgling in a stomach on your first mission!

“Not so fast. We need to come up with a plan…” You tap your chin. “Hmm… that roserade looks like their leader. He’s definitely the toughest. Should we ambush him and see if we can take him out first? Or should we take out his lackies first, so we don’t have to worry about getting attacked from the rear while we fight him?”
1432121.title: Guild Tactics

choices: Let Willis move in for a Fire Spin!
14321212.content:
“We’re fire types… and most of these outlaws are either weak, or grass types…” He narrows his eyes, scanning over the crowd. “If we take them by surprise and concentrate enough flames on him, we can have this guy’s entire group knocked out before they know what hit em. Then he’ll be a sitting duck.”

“Alright. Sounds like a plan,” you nod, your fur standing on edge from the tension as you slowly approach the camp. Your ears perk up as you draw closer, hearing the bandits chatter to themselves.

“Aaaahhh… sooo soft~!” Happily cooed that roserade, who seemed to be sprawled out over one of the cheeks of the massive golden butt. “It’s just like the real thing, but shiny! This has to be one of the best loot we’ve ever stolen… so worth the heist!”

“Yeah… real shame about Mary, though…” The skiploom shivered sadly at the memory. “When he caught her, I thought he’d just eat her. I didn’t expect him to start… slipping him up his behind like that…”

“Yeah, but feeling how soft this is… maybe she was the lucky one!” The roserade giggled, continuing her butt snuggling.

You blushed, your eyes widening at their banter. Did that ninetales really… stuff somebody up his derriere? That would certainly explain why his rump was so huge… and that squirming belly… but still, you didn’t even know anything like that was possible!

It seemed Willis still had his eyes on the prize, though, disregarding the banter and creeping up closer. He gestured for you to catch up, and you shook your head, composing yourself and starting to crawl forward again…

“Hmm…?” Eventually, one of the nidoran’s ears perk up, having apparently heard something suspicious. “Is anybody there?” You and Willis stay still as the nidoran approaches the tall grass, looking out for any signs of movement… and with that, Willis gives the signal.

Suddenly, two bursts of fire emerge from the bushes, long streams of flame slamming right into the nidoran with enough force to send her flying backwards! Those pillars of flames do a quick sweep across the entire camp, then, immediately stunning all the vulnerable grass-types!

When the gloom moved forward to counter-attack, Willis lept from the bushes with his claw raised, jumping out from the safety of his cover to him her with a fury swipes attack up close! She goes flying backwards… but to your shock, a nidoran jumps out behind Willis, about to hit him with her own attack!

Thinking fast, you reach out from the bushes, grab the nidoran by the sides… and before she can event react, you jab her into your gaping maw! You let out a wince at feeling your throat stretch so suddenly and so harshly, but you had to get her down before she could even struggle!

In a matter of seconds, you matter to trap the nidoran girl in your big, gurgling belly, and by the chance she had the opportunity to wriggle for freedom, it was too late! You shudder at the feeling… only to yelp in surprise as you felt a sharp pain go through your side!

You turn with a grunt to see the roserade standing there, pouting! “Hey! Stop eating my teammates!” She shouted angrily at you. You felt a nauseous feeling in your gut all of a sudden, but you try to ignore you. You just had to defeat this roserade...
14321212.title: Bane of Outlaws

143212122.content:
“You JERKS! I’m gonna tan your-“ The roserade shouted, unaware that while you were keeping her distracted, the charmeleon’s flame wheel was about to slam into her side! She had no idea it was coming until it hit, sending her flying in a burst of sparks and embers! “AUGH!”

“Hiya!” While she’s still flying through the air, Willisjumps forwards and starts slashing like crazy with fuy swipes, to the point that, by the time they landed, the nidoran limply bounced off a tree, dazed and weakened. “That’ll teach ya!” He smiled, pride welling in his chest when he saw how easily he had dispatched of his enemy.

With that, the charmeleon looked around for the next threat… but there wasn’t any. He realized that all of the outlaws were either thoroughly the defeated, or currently wriggling in your gut. With that, he turns to you, the most adorable look of excitement dawning on his face. “Oliver… we did it! We totally kicked their butts!”

Overjoyed at having basically succeeded at your very first mission, he rushed forward and wrapped you in just about the tightest huh ever! Though notably, the moment he came close, your tummy let out a long, rumbling gurgle! “Heh… you wanna have a bandit feast, don’t you~?” He giggled, looking over the defeated outlaws and licking his lips. You can’t help but nod. The stomach wants what it wants, after all. “Alright, then! To the victors go the spoils!”

That other nidoran is sprawled out on the battlefield… only to feel something wet surrounding her paws. She looks down just in time to watch you slip her entire torso into your gullet! “N-no… knock that off…!” She gasps in shock, trying futilely to wriggle… but just moments later, she’s disappeared completely past your lips! “Mph!”

You coo at her flavor as she slides over your tongue. before turning into a big, squirming bulge in your throat. You smile, letting it rest there for a while… before finally taking another gulp, squeezing her into your cramped, gross stomach with her friend, dooming them both to a fate of gurgling into another layer of your soft pudge. Your tongue hangs out as you bask in the utter bliss from the flavor of the duo imprisoned within your gut.

Meanwhile, the gloom was shivering beneath Willis as he squished his belly down on top of her… a belly that was now rapidly being filled with the the roselia! The gloomy seemed understandably upset as that bulge travelled down his throat, and that belly she was trapped under bulged and squirmed as her friend settled into his tight gut. He giggled as he leaned forward, showing off his maw. “Your friend was scrumptious~” He smiled. “Care to join her?”

Meanwhile, you were dragging your belly along behind you as you crawled devious after the skiploom, who was waddling away as fast as she could. Not fast enough, though… as soon, your mouth wrapped around the small Pokemon easily in a single movement, your cheeks bulging out as you ran your tongue over her, savoring your flavor. Soon, you sent her down your gullet to join your other two prisoners.

Soon, the dazed and recovering roserade was met with the sight of two huge, bulging bellies looming over him! “Looks like this outlaw career - urrrppp - didn’t work out too well for your friends here!” Willis laughed, as the both of you rubbed your hands over your bellies as they noisily digest their prisoners, showing them off. “But I’m happy to say they’ll serve a much better career as our pudge~”

“You… jerks…” The roserade spat viciously at you… but in response, you both just squished her between your tummies! She groaned as she was squished harshly between those two huge bellies, feeling every movement and hearing the distressed protests of the outlaws inside.

“Hmmm… what do you think, Oliver?” He asked with a lick of his lips as he grinned down at the roserade you were keeping tightly pinned between your huge, round, gurgling guts, treating her to a cacophony of gurgling and digestion. “Should we take her back to get that extra reward? Or… well, I gotta admit, I’m a lil tempted to send her to join her pals~”
143212122.title: A Nice Filling Wriggly Bandit Meal

choices: If what he's doing isn't illegal, there's nothing you can do.
1432121221.content:
“Nah… this is our first mission! We really should try and do the best we can possibly do!” You shake your head. The roserade seems to be relieved, while Willis seemed to be a little disappointed, but he understood your reasoning.

“Yeah, yer right. Alright, I’ll her put ‘er in the bag…” With that, he just easily slid er into the bag the two of you had brought along, along with that big, golden butt sculpture, he hefted it onto his back with a huff, finding it to be super heavy now… but before he could complain about that, he turned to find you looking queasy.

“Urrrggh…” You were turning a little green, clutching your side as you suddenly felt ill.

“Uh, hey, are you alright, buddy?” Willis raised a brow, looking down to see if all the Pokemon in your belly were causing you to feel sick. “Did ya have too much to eat?”

“No, it’s just… ugh…” You hunched over a bit, gritting your teeth as a feeling of pure nausea washing over your body like a wave! “I think she poisoned me…”

“Ah, crap…” He sighed, wrapping an arm around your shoulder to help you not just fall over. “Alright, c’mon. Let’s get you to a doctor or something…” With that, he stumbled towards town, struggling to keep up both you and his heavy bag.

It felt like it took absolutely forever to make it back to town… but when you did, you almost immediately noticed a doctor’s office in the distance. Upon bringing you inside, a big white flower florges behind the counter immediately began wringing her hands with concern at the sorry sight of you.

“Oh, dear! You poor thing! You look terrible…!” She pressed her hands against her cheeks in concern, before ushering you towards a back room without you even having to pay her beforehand. “Come in, come in, please! Right this way.”

Willis hesitantly let's go of you to let you walk towards a back room, sitting up on a table while the florges follows along closely behind. “Hey, doc…” You stutter, still feeling a growing feeling of pure illness. “I… got poisoned… fighting some bandits out there…”

“Oh, how terrible! Here, this should heal you right up,” she frowns, holding up a pecha berry. You quickly start to chow down while she holds your hand, and the berry almost instantly makes you feel better! You coo in delight as she continues. “Did you manage to deal with those bandits?”

“Yeah, it was no big deal,” you wave a hand, dismissively. “Apparently, they had stolen a… uh, religious relic from that ninetales at the churn here…”

“You mean Sebastian?” She asks, and surprised she knew him, you nod. “Oh, him! He runs the strangest little temple! The worst part is, my son’s ran off to join that little ‘order’ of his…”

“Huh? What’s wrong with that?” You tilt your head, suddenly feeling nervous.

“Problem is, they’re all dedicated to worshipping that ninetale’s… derriere!” She shudders. “Initiates at that church only become true members once they, uh… become part of it.”

Once again, a blush rises on your cheeks as you process her words! Was that what they meant, when they mentioned that ninetales sucking Pokemon up his… well, behind? “You mean like…?”

“Mhmm…” She nods solemnly, finding the idea much more gross than alluring, unlike you. “If nobody convinces him to leave that church of his, I’m afraid it’s only a matter of time until he’s…”

You squint, laying a hand against your head, trying to figure this all out. “Why don’t the guards get involved with this?”

“The members of his church all become part of his body voluntarily… it isn’t a crime to eat willing Pokemon… even with your behind…” She sighs, before looking up at you. “You’re a guild member, right? Well, can you see if you can convince my son to leave that terrible church, before it’s too late?”
1432121221.title: Rumors of the Church of Booty

14321212211.content:
“Uh…” You’re feeling a little dizzy and flustered just thinking about this… but you try your best to focus on the fact that a citizen is in trouble. “Well, if it’s legal… I can’t really stop him… but I’ll try my best to convince him to leave, if I can meet him…”

“Thank you. I respect his wishes, but I really don’t think becoming pudge for some random ninetales is what’s best for him. If he wants to become pudge, it should at least be on someone he loves,” she shakes her head, sadly. “If you can bring him home, I will make sure to give you a reward.”

“Alright, ma’am! Thank you for the pecha berry!” You give her what little Pokes it was worth, before trotting back out to find Willis sitting on that bag, taking a break, while the roserade protests. You smile, patting that big round gut of his, feeling the bandits squirming about within. With a big meal like that, it’ll take a few hours for em to stop fighting the inevitable.

“Feelin’ better, Oliver?” He smiles, standing up and wrapping you in a tight hug, letting both of your engorged, grumbling bellies squish and compact together as you nuzzle one another. “Alright! I think I found this church of Sebastian’s on the map. Let’s head over there!”

As you follow along towards the church, you can’t really get your mind off everything you’ve been told. You can’t tell if Willis is just oblivious to it all, or completely indifferent. Were you just overreacting? It’s like you just couldn’t get the image of that ninetale’s tush out of your mind for some reason…

You’re a little surprised when you finally come across that little church. You half-expected it to look like a giant butt or something, but really, it resembled a regular, quaint small church, if ninetales-themed. There was a name above the entrance, but it must’ve been written in another language or something.

Just as you neared, you were surprised by the sight of the ninetales trotting right out, as if knowing you were there somehow! “Welcome, my darlings, to my humble little order!” He smiled. This time, you didn’t even mind that he called you ‘darling’. “I’m sure those outlaws were no match at all for such big, strong explorers~”

You blush, getting more than a little blushy and flustered at his flattery. “U-uuuuh… no sir! Easy peasy! We’ve got them all right here!” You give a sheepish smile as you slap your belly with your paw, rousing all the Pokemon trapped inside and revealing their bulging movements.

“Hehe! Wonderful! Just where they belong~” He chuckles, and you blush harder as he reaches out to rub your engorged belly, enjoying feeling the outlaws wriggling within. “And what of the sculpture and the roserade, hmm?”

“Right here!” Willis was relieved to finally be able to turn over and empty out the leather bag, with the big golden sculpture, as well as the tied up and gagged roserade, flopping out on the ground. With a chuckle, the ninetales collects them with his tail.

“Lovely! You boys have done wonderfully! Have your payment, for services rendered~” He smiles, as he tossed over a big bag of coins. “And of course, a bonus for the roserade!” He smiled as he reached out and handed you a Stealth Scarf! You marvelled as you gazed down at it, finding it all blue and black.

“Wow, thank you!” You nod excitedly as you slide the scarf on, already feeling a new power filling you. With that, it seemed the ninetales was going to retreat back into his church… but he paused, his huge, round, perfect rump angled at you as he stood faced away from you. “Oh, yes. By the by, you darlings wouldn’t happen to want to see around my church, would you?”

Willis was a little incredulous about this whole church thing from the beginning, so he shook his head. “Nah. I’m good.”

“What about you, darling?” You bite your lip as Sebastian turns to you, his beautiful, piercing eyes gazing right into your’s. Willis didn’t seem to understand, but you couldn’t help but be tempted by the thought, suspicious as this church may be...
14321212211.title: Mission Accomplished At Last

choices: Try and convince that Pokemon to come home
Just talk with Sebastian some more
143212122111.content:
“Really? You’re going with this guy…?” Willis tilts his head, his tail flicking behind him, seeming rather surprised that you’d just want to run off with some random ninetales into a creepy church. “Why?”

“I dunno, man…” You sheepishly shrug, not even sure how to describe what you’re feeling. “I wanna… befriend the citizens around here, you know? Isn’t that part of my duty?”

“Umm… okay,” he said. He obviously seemed concerned that it would turn out that this ninetales was some sort of predator, trying to lure you on your own. “Just… make sure he doesn’t try anything funny, alright?”

“No need to worry! I shall make sure no harm befalls your friend here,” Sebastian smiled, his fluffy side sliding along your back as he curls up halfway around you, nuzzling you close. “So, shall we, darling? I can make things comfy for you in the temple.”

You blush as you nod, and Willis can only stand there and watch incredulously as the huge-rumped ninetales leads you away in the temple. Figuring that it was up to fate now, the charmeleon could just stumble off, grumbling to himself. Meanwhile, you were surprised by how beautiful and ornate it was in this little temple.

“It’s quite a beautiful place, isn’t it?” Sebastian smiled, walking forward and placing the big, golden butt statue back in its rightful place… before dropping that outlaw on the ground before him. “I shall show you around, as soon as I am finished with this miscreant. Sound alright?”

Your heart immediately starts pumping in your chest as he looms over her. Was he really going to…? “Mm. Good evening, thief. You seem to have found yourself in quite a predicament, haven’t you?” He teased, the roserade looking rather bummed as the ninetales glowing eyes shined down on her. “All bound up with no one to rescue you. Well, no worries, darling. You are sure to enjoy what comes next, trust me~”

He taps his chin, as if contemplating. “One question still bothers me - why would you go and steal such a strange sculpture? It cost me so much to create… and it’s not like you could pawn it off anywhere…” He asks, looking back at the strange butt-shaped statue. “Though… you didn’t steal it for the money, did you? No… I think it was pure admiration~”

Your blush only deepened when he turned around, letting his massive rump loom over her, each of his jiggly cheeks bigger than her entire body! “Well, if my rush was what you were wanting, why didn’t ya just go for the real thing~?” She blushes too at the sight, wide-eyed at the perfect rump… only for it to plop right down on her! “Ah… there you go. Is it just like you imagined?”

He bit his lip, grinding that squishy, soft rump down on her for a while. She wasn’t struggling at all… it must be absolutely bliss, up inbetween those huge, soft cheeks. Your face was all red as you tried to convince yourself you weren’t jealous of her. To your surprise, when he eventually stood up, she was plastered against his rump… with her head buried between deep those thick cheeks!

“Aaah… there we go! It seems like she’s going to fit back there, with a little effort!” A shiver spread over your entire body as he wriggled that huge, powerful, dangerous rump in your direction. “You. Oliver, darling. Would you mind giving me a hand with this? It can be quite a daunting task with someone her size.”

“U-uhh…” You stutter, wide-eyed. Your heart felt like it was about to pump out of your chest, and yet, somehow, you still felt compelled by his words to step forward. “O… okay…” You gasp quietly as you place your paws on each of his cheeks, feeling just how SOFT they were. How soft must it be between them…?

“Just grab her by the waist and held to slide her forward. My rump shall do the rest.” Once again, you were stunned at the mere thought of what he was asking you to do… but still, your body moves almost on its own, compelling you to follow his instructions. His whole body tenses up as you reach forward and push her more into his rump with surprising ease! “Aaaah… that hits the spot…!”

You were in awe at the power of that ass! Your jaw hanging open as you managed to slide her easily into the dark canyon between those cheeks with every minor push. “Mmm… just a little more darling!” He panted once she was halfway in. “Get her firmly in there, and my derriere will be able to handle the rest…”

Sure enough, once her legs were dangling out, you could just let go… and watch in awe as gravity slid them right into his ass on its own. You could only watch as that tailhole slid closed, as if nothing had happened, sealing the roserade to her fate. She hadn’t even struggled. “Oooh! Mmph! Ah~ Here she goes! Aaaah… mmm… all tucked away. See? Easier than you imagined, I take it?”

“You…” You felt like you were about to faint as he stood up, relaxing with a dopey expression on his face, looking over his shoulder and batting those long eyelashes at you as he swayed that big, fat rump. “How did you… do that…?”

“Much practice, my dear. Dozens of Pokemon have likely added to that rump you’re admiring,” he said, and you did a double-take. “Pokemon are naturally stretchy, darling. If you experiment, I think you’ll find you’re capable of swallowing Pokemon with more than just your mouth.”

“But… but…” You stutter. “Why?”

“Oh, don’t play coy! I saw the awe on your face. You know exactly why.” He smiled, showing off his rump as he paced around the room, the roserade settling in his belly as he gave his explanation.

“It is only the natural way of things, for Pokemon to become part of other Pokemon. It’s going to happen to all of us one day… all of our lives leading up to the moment another decides to add us to their hips. Most prey are a casual snack, gulped down and completely forgotten, their name fading into the annals of history, a layer of pudge being their own memory…”

“I will say it plainly; my followers come to me because they want to be part of my derriere. It’s a strange wish, you might think… but you can’t judge someone for wanting to become part of something much larger than themselves. Physically and figuratively… hehe.”

“My followers come to me for a variety of reasons. Some have had loved ones become fat on my rump, and they want to join them. Some are interested because it’s a more rare and novel way to go than merely being swallowed. And I confess, many come to me purely for the… erotic aspect.”

“But I am a noble predator. I remember each and every one of the followers I’ve turned into pudge on my rump, and leading up to them becoming part of me, I spend upwards of weeks with them everyday, caring for and speaking with them. What more could someone ask for in a predator?”

You were completely silent, stunned after all that information, and he only giggled. “I understand I’m dropping a lot of information on you, sugar. Don’t worry about it too much, ultimately. This church will be gone soon, after all,” he smiled, leaning in close. “Now, after that spiel… why don’t we enjoy some tea?”

Before you knew it, you were sitting at a small table with him, enjoying cups of tea he poured. At least, you were supposed to. All you could really do was sit there thinking about everything you had learned… and whether you wanted to go talk to that florge’s son, or even continue messing with this cult at all...
143212122111.title: The Truth of the Tush

1432121221111.content:
“If you may excuse me…” You push yourself away from the table. Partly out of interest of helping that Florges, and partly because you needed to be away from the ninetale’s alluring aura for a while. “I would like to talk with one of your followers.”

“By all means.” The ninetales nodded, as you trotted away, still awestruck by everything you’d seen and heard. As you walked through the halls, all you could notice was all the Pokemon that seemed to be followers of Sebastian, and imagine their fate of sliding right up that tight rump...

You try to shake those thoughts from your head, however, when you noticed a floette floating around, apparently praying! “Um… excuse me?” You nervously tap his shoulder, or whatever suffices for a shoulder. “Is your mother the florges that runs the clinic near here…?”

He turns around, raising a brow at your sudden appearance. “Why, yes she is, sir!” He nods. “Why? Has she sent for me?”

“Yeah, uh…” You nod, sheepishly, not even sure how to talk about this after everything you’ve just heard. “She… she wants you to come home. Leave this little… church thing.” In response, he just sort of sighs, looking glumly down at the ornate wooden floor.

“I’ve been trying to make her understand what Sebastian is trying to do here…” He sadly shakes his head. “I feel for my mother, I really do! But she doesn’t understand that some Pokemon just don’t want to go on and live full, ambitious lives like her. Some Pokemon were just meant to become pudge. Why not get it over with?”

“Hmm…” You look at him with concern, although deep down, you completely understand his reluctance. “So… there’s really not anything else you want to do?”

“I’ve already fulfilled my life’s purpose. Now, all I want is to become part of something larger…” He says, the dedication in his voice making it obvious it’d be impossible to change his mind. “She must have sent you because the Reunion is tomorrow.”

You blink, uncomprehending.“The what?”

“It’s the big ritual that’ll signal the end of his church. To put it plainly… Sebastian plans to give every one of his current followers a choice,” he explains. “Either leave, or become part of his rump. Those that stay shall be churned up into fat on his rump, all at the same time.”

You feel the redness returning to your cheeks, imagining the ninetales shoving every single Pokemon in this church up his rump at the same time. Was the even possible? And… how big would his rump get afterwards? “Why would he want to end the church…?”

“He says he wants to go out and adventure. Help Pokemon across Zaplana, not just in Juniper Town,” he sighs. “Besides, people around here have been calling this church a cult…”

You both sit in silence for a while, before he turns to you. “Listen, I won’t leave the church. I want to become part of Sebastian,” he concludes. “But I really visit my mother tonight, for one last goodbye. Hopefully, that will make her feel better about all this…”

“Well… guess it’s as good a compromise as any,” you shrug weakly, before trotting off to go your separate ways. Really, as you try and figure out everything you’ve been told, you slowly come to realize you had two options. Option A - probably the smarter choice - was to just leave this church and forget about all this.

Option B was to attend this ‘Reunion’ yourself, and help the ninetales with that… impressive task. You’d take Willis along so he can see what the ninetales is capable of… with this, after all, seeing is believing. You didn’t know why you’d even go with this option… other than that seeing such a ritual would surely be a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity, if ever there’s been one...

1454411.title: Zorua

choices: The guildmaster has an announcement to make!
14544111.content:
*Yaaaawwwwn!*

You let out a huge yawn as you awoke from your slumber. You desperately wanted to go back to sleep, but the sun was directly in your eyes, and you couldn't. You took a moment to rub your eyes, before you remembered something important. Today was your first day as a member of Juniper Town's guild! You sprang out of bed, quickly gathered your things, and headed to the dining hall.

You are Maxwell, a young Zorua who has always dreamed of being a famous explorer. You've been trying to join the guild for nearly a year now, but the guild is very strict on it's age requirement. But you've still been preparing yourself for a life of adventure, practicing your moves, exploring the small dungeons just outside of town, and of course, gobbling up as many small Pokemon as you could. Just last week, after your birthday, you applied to the guild, and last night, they invited you in! How exciting!

These thoughts were running through your head as you made your way to the dining hall. It was almost time for breakfast, and then you would get to meet your mentor and teammates! The smell of food snapped you out of it however, and you hurried to the dining hall.

As you entered, you were in awe at how just how many Pokemon were here, you could see at least two dozen from the door, and there were surely more besides! You saw tons of strong looking pokemon, happily chatting to each other, and stuffing themselves on the huge amount of food available. There were even a couple whose bellies were wiggling. There must have been some volunteers, or captured outlaws, you concluded.

Finished looking around the room, your eyes quickly found their way to the breakfast line. Your rumbling stomach told you it wasn't willing to wait any longer, so you got in line. You grabbed a plate, and piled it high with a variety of different breakfast foods. Pancakes, toast, eggs, omelettes, a little bit of everything found it's way onto your plate. You then placed the plate on your back with practiced ease, and began looking for a place to sit.

You didn't have to look long however, as you quickly spotted an Eevee flagging you down. You didn't recognize her, but she certainly seemed excited to see you.

"Hey, are you the new kid? I'm Marisu! I think we are going to be on the same team!" She said without pausing for breath.

"Uh, yeah. I'm Maxwell. I just joined last night." You replied.

"Sweet! We have so much to talk about." She launched into a series of seemingly random questions. What your favorite color was, what your favorite food was, etc... While she continued to ask questions, you simply sat down and began to inhale your breakfast, only pausing to breathe every now and again. This continued for a little while before a loud noise caught you attention.

What was it?
14544111.title: Maxwell the Zorua

15.content:
You are the noble leader of the entire Exploration Guild! You might not be the strongest Pokemon in the guild, but you're definitely the most influential, with everybody else being below you in status. You have the authority to do basically anything you want, but if you act too rashly or cruelly, your own guild members might plan a mutiny! Since this specific guild is themed after the ocean, please make sure that all the species options are water-types.

Speaking of which, we have to decide on your species...
15.title: With Great Power...

choices: Patrol the wasters of the harbor
Lend her water to the farm crops
152.content:
The Good Ship Ogygia gently rolled into the sleepy harbor of Juniper Town just before dawn could break. The inhabitants of the little village lied sleeping in their beds, not knowing that, after so many moths of drought and troubles, hope had come back into their lives. The ship docked in their waters was the home of the acclaimed and famous Pokemon Guild! Their Sigilyph detected their plight, and arrangements were made to set course to the slowly dying hamlet. Now that they were here, things would surely pick up!

The Oygia’s Cabin Boy, a rather diminutive and young Riolu, was tasked of alerting their captain that they had made port. Although that was normally a job for the ship’s first mate and not some lowly ranking errand boy, he was the captains favorite errand boy, and seeing him always put her in a good mood. And they needed her in her highest spirits possible to start the day off right.

The tiny jackall Pokemon descended down the many stairs of the massive ship into the lowest section of the Oygia. It was dark and poorly lit, and something always had to be repaired as the wood was rotten and soggy. In the farthest end of the stern lied the ship’s Lazarette, which doubled as the captain’s quarters. With a heavy inhale of breath, the Riolu pushed the heavy, double doors and entered the sanctum of their guild leader.

He had thought after seeing her so many times, he would get used to her appearance. But every time he opened the door to Captain Calypso's Lazarette, he was utterly blown away by how immense she was. The room was lavishly decorated with pretty little things that sparkled, a worthy collection gathered from their exploits on the high seas. In the middle of the room was an open body of water, and in that body of water was the Milotic called Calypso.

The gigantic and obese serpent Pokemon smiled down at her favorite cabin boy as he took in the sheer excess of her frame. Years of dealing out due punishment on the scum of the waves had left her more than well fed. Her body was so huge and so powerful, she acted as her ship’s own rudder, moving the gigantic structure that housed her guild with ease and speed.

“Captain Calypso!” The small Riolu gave his captain a proper salute, always a little on edge in her presence. No because she was scary to him, quite the opposite! The little jackal thought she looked stunning, which made him feel rather weird and unsure of himself. “We’ve arrived at Juniper Town, thank you for guiding us a safe journey once again!”

“Ahhh…” Calypso opened her mouth to speak, an angelic and soothing feminine voice erupting out as she slithered her body towards the her diminutive employee. She pressed her lardy snout into his chest in an affectionate nuzzle, putting a reluctant smile on the Riolu’s face. “You are quite welcome, my little one. Now, if you would please, may you set up the preparations for my sunrise speech?” She batted her eyelids at him, her sparkling eyes calming his soul and putting him a state of tranquility.

“Mph, of course Captain Calypso!” The Little Riolu saluted once again, this time with genuine enthusiasm, and ran out of the Lazarette to tell the crew their new orders. Calypso smiled and sank beneath the waves of her ship, swimming out of her quarters and into the harbor of a Juniper Town.

An hour later, the sun had come up, and the Pokémon of Juniper Town had gathered around the dock. The Pokémon Guild was here! They were saved! The crew of the Oygia made way for their captain’s Cabin Boy as the Riolu climbed up the stairs to a makeshift stage. “People of Juniper Town!” He yelled out as far as his little lungs would let him. “Give a round of cheer for our captain, Calypso!”

The waters behind the makeshift stage parted to reveal a massive, stunning Milotic around the size of her own ship. The morning sun’s light bounced off spectacularly from her fat scales, making her gleam with color and shine. The crowd around the dock erupted into applause at the little light show, and Calypso gave out a warm smile as she reached herself for her speech.

“My fellow Pokémon,” she began with a calm tone. “Thank you all so much for being patient with us. We are sorry that we did not come sooner in your time if need. Now, however, we are here, and we are here to help. I promise you all, this town will once again be known for it’s beautiful flowers and crops, and the culprit behind this drought will be brought to justice!” Her little speech ended in a big finish after rising tempo, the Milotic shaking her expansive form to emphasize the punishment that the culprit will receive.

The crows once again bursted Into cheer, this time much more loud. All was good now, as long as the Oygia stayed in their docks. After some fanfare, the crowd dispersed back into Juniper Town, and exploration teams began teaming the streets, looking for ways that they can help. Calypso smiled at the affair play out, happy that she could be of help…

...and that her belly would soon be full of delicious troublemakers.

What is Calypso’s first order of business?
152.title: Calypso the Milotic

choices: She slurps him into her mouth for some maw play
She comes in to smother him
She comes in close for some playful kisses
1524.content:
Calypso looked on happily as several of her men disbar from the ship and onto the docks. She was already anticipating them helping out the residents of this town, and anticipating them getting her a few snacks. However, she figured she had some time to kill before they did their thing. And she knew a certain someone to kill that time with~

The young Riolu was left on the ship while the rest of the crew was unloading, him tasked with tending to the ship's stations and making sure they're in good shape. He held a bucket of water in one hand, and a washcloth in the other. Some believed he'd eventually build some muscle and get himself ready for the real battlefield. But, for now, he could only clean. At least, until Calypso poked her head over the side of the side of the ship, a soft smile on her lips.

"Psst~" she whispered out. The Riolu's sensitive ears caught her voice, and looked over. At that, he lowered his washcloth, tapped his indices together, and approached her, feeling that same unsure feeling fill his stomach.

"Hello, Captain Calypso," he said, a nervous edge to his voice. Her beautiful smile didn't ease him.

"I deeply appreciate your work up here, but before you continue with this, I think you deserve a break," Calypso said.

"A... break?" the cabin boy questioned, tilting his head like a confused canine. Sure, he practically just started, but if this captain were offering... "Th-thank you ma'am."

"Now, why don't you spend that break down with me?" The cabin boy's ears stiffened at her suggestion, and he felt his legs quake underneath him.

"W-with you...?" he parroted. Calypso nodded her head.

"I mean, I'm going to be alone while the rest of the crew are working off the ship. I think a little company will help make the time fly by." Calypso batted her eyes at him, filling the cabin boy's stomach with butterflies.

"O-of course, ma'am!" he answered sharply. At that, he set down his washcloth and ran down the ship, right towards the cabin. In the meantime, Calypso swam over to the back of the ship, sliding in to her cabin and waiting for the boy. Soon, the Lazarette doors opened up, though Calypso couldn't help but notice a pause between the sound of his footsteps and when he started pushing the doors. He approached, hands clasped tightly around each other, as he approached the edge, the immense Milotic's face near it.

"Thank you for this, dear~" she cooed out, causing the Riolu to look away while he rung his fingers together.

"No problem, captain..." he said, cautiously looking upon her face. He stood there for a while, the captain simply eyeing him up for a while, contemplating how to play with him.
1524.title: Play with her Cabin Boy~

choices: The Guild has caught someone for Calyso
15241.content:
The massive and fat sea serpent smiled possessively over her cute little Cabin Boy as she slithered her expansive form across the wooden floor of her Lazarette. The old oak creaked ominously under her impossible weight, making the Riolu give out a frightened cry as he backed away slowly from the encroaching captain. Calypso giggled daintily as she observed him stumble back into the heavy doors as she closed the distance between them. "Don't tell me you're afraid, my little employee." She purred as she gently smooshed her light muzzle into his form, making him blush. "You couldn't possibly think you're in danger with me..."

The Riolu Cabin Boy let out a small whine as his captain warmed his body. "S-sorry, Captain Calypso..." He offered, cautiously placing his small paws on the muzzle of the Mioltic in a slow hug. "It's just that...you're so big, and I'm so small...". Despite his underlying fear, he felt strangely placid in the presence of the great Pokemon. He owed his life to her, or so the crew of the Oygia had explained to him. The story went that he was the sole survivor of a shipwreck and that Calypso managed to save him before drowning in the water when he was so young.

"Mmmm...true. I have to be one of the biggest Pokémon in the whole wide world, and you have to be one of the smallest." She playfully teased, making him red under his fur. Suddenly, Calypso raised her head over so slightly so that she may pucker her lips and envelop the small Pokemon's body in a loving kiss! The kiss lasted around ten seconds before she released him, leaving him dazed with a happy grin on his face. "But That doesn't mean I can't play with my favorite Riolu..."

The Riolu's heart fluttered and his stomach swelled with butterflies as he recovered from the kiss. Why did he feel so strange? His legs felt like gelatin and he found himself leaning onto his captain for support, only making her smile widen. "...um, could you...uh...do that again, please?" Riolu practically begged as he stared into the Milotic's dazzling eyes. The big snake purred again and obliged his request, smothering him in another kiss that took his breath away.

The Riolu was so caught up with the big smooch that he was receiving that he didn't realize that he was being slurped up into her maw! He didn't know what was happening until it was too late, his little paws kicking the air as she slurped them last her lips like noodles. "Wah!" He cried out in fear as his world was plunged in darkness. "Ca-captain Calypso, what are you doing?!"

Calypso didn't answer, she was too busy enjoying the delicious flavor that her Cabin Boy provided. She rolled her head on pleasure as her tongue carefully swisher over his flailing body, so sweet and nice, soft and wiggly. The Milotic suckled down on his body as she chewed him between her toothless gums as if he was a lollipop or a piece of gum.

"Ah, my Cabin Boy..." The Milotic swooned as she tossed the Riolu in her slimy maw to one side of her cheeks to speak. "Oh, you have to be the tastiest thing I've ever had...ahhh..."

"Ca-Calypso..." The terrified Riolu stammered as he cuddled up to the Milotic's cheek for warmth, making a squirming bulge appear on her fat. "Are you gonna...eat me?"

"Oh, my poor sweet Riolu, no..." Calypso breathed as she gently rolled her serpentine tongue over his body, trying to comfort him. "No, I would never eat you. You're too tasty a sweetie pie to ever leave this world. I'm so sorry I scared you, but it's not so bad being my lollipop, right?"

The Riolu shivered as the big tongue slathered goopy saliva all over his form. Although he was still greatly unnerved about what had just happened...it wasn't all too bad, when he thought about it. He had no reason to doubt Calypso's word, she had never lied to him before, so he no longer felt like he was in danger of being her food. The maw of the serpent was warm and kind of soft, and the slimy saliva acted as a sort of blanket...

"I guess...it is a little fun in here..." The Riolu relented, having trouble believing his own words. "So, um...can I come out, now?"

"Mmmm...no, my Riolu." She let out in pleasure as she began to slither her way back towards the water, making her occupant freak out a little. "You've always been telling me that you wanted to go on a mission of yourself, right? Well, think of this as your first mission. You are coming with me so we can help the people of Juniper Town back to their former glory." Ignoring the stifled protests the Riolu gave out, the great Milotic plunged herself underneath the waves, clamping her mouth shut so no water would come in her maw.

The Riolu Cabin Boy tired to be pouty about the situation, but he couldn't help but feel excited. He was going to spend the whole day helping people along with Calypso! Maybe he could learn some pointers on how to be big and strong, or get to go on a real mission! Calypso smiled as she felt the little Pokemon inside her maw squirm in delight as he thought of what was going to happen in the day. Such a cute little thing...

Calypso docked herself along the beach of Juniper Town's harbor as she deposited her little Riolu gently in the shallow water to clean off. The little jackall let out a cry of shock as the cold water shook him out of his fantasies, but at the same time, it invigorated him for what was to come in the day later.
15241.title: A Kiss Taken Too Far?

info.brief_description: Weight gain and vore in the world of Pokemon Mystery Dungeon.
info.description:
Despite the fact that there's a ton of vorish Pokemon interactives, I've always been bummed out by the fact that I couldn't find any about Pokemon Mystery Dungeon, a spinoff series that's always fascinated me even more than the main series. There's been PMD-themed routes in other interactives, but I can't find any that are completely focused on PMD related shenanigans. So, it seems my only choice is to make one myself!

How the World Works: In case you don't know, the world of Pokemon Mystery Dungeon is inhabited entirely by Pokemon! That means no anthros, no humans, no animals, no digimon, and no fakemon. While the main focus is on stuffing, weight gain, and vore and such, all sorts of other kinks can also be experienced throughout the world.

How Eating Works: Have you ever seen how massive the average berry is in the Pokemon universe? Needless to say, every food item in this interactive will be weirdly huge, and the average meal will lead Pokemon to having at least big, round, full-looking bellies. However, their metabolisms are designed to compensate for this, so just stuffing yourself normally won't lead to any weight gain. If you REALLY stuff yourself silly, though, you'll experience some pretty rapid weight gain, able to earn pounds and pounds of pudge over the course of a single day! You lose weight just as easily, though, and there are upper limits; it's impossible to become a big, unrecognizable blob of fat or anything.

How Vore Works: Every Pokemon has naturally stretchy throats and stomachs in order to hold all that food, which has the side effect of allowing them to swallow other Pokemon! This is a skill that will have to be trained. At first, swallowing prey will give you a sore throat and a terrible tummyache, and digestion will take all day! Experienced preds, however, will be able to swallow and gurgle prey with scary ease! With some effort and training, other forms of vore might also be possible, but much more difficult. There is currently no known method of safe vore or reformation; however, preds have a window of time they can spit their prey out before digestion begins.
